analyzed: yid kyi sngom pa ni /
translated: The vow of the mind is

analyzed: brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba spangs pa'i 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: the complete purity of the three spheres of abandoning covetousness, ill-will, and wrong views.

analyzed: las yongs su dag pa ni rmi lam lta bu'i chos rnams la mngon par zhen pa med par thams cad du 'jug pa'o //

analyzed: dmigs pa las yang dag par 'da' ba zhes bya ba ni sems tsam sgyu ma lta bur rtogs pas phyi dang nang gi gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rjes su mi dmigs pa'o // phung po yongs su shes pa ni gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po rnams dbu ba gong bu dang / chu bur dang / smig rgyu dang / chu shing gi sdong po dang /
translated: ‚Äú Transcending the object‚Äù means that by realizing mind only as being like an illusion, one does not observe outer and inner apprehended objects and apprehending subjects.

original: sgyu ma lta bu nyid du yongs su shes pa'o //üîΩkhams mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu nyid du yongs su shes pa'o // khams mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba ni /
translated: ‚Äú Understanding the aggregates‚Äù means understanding the aggregates of form, feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness to be like a mass of foam, a bubble, a mirage, a plantain tree, and an illusion, respectively.

original: khams bco brgyad po rnams sprul pa lta bur mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: khams bco brgyad po rnams sprul pa lta bur mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: ‚Äú The sameness of the elements‚Äù means that the eighteen elements are the same as a magical creation.

original: skye mched sel ba dang zhes bya ba ni skye mched bcu gnyis po rnams gzugs brnyan dang 'dra bas rang bzhin med pa nyid du khong du chud pa'o //
analyzed: skye mched sel ba dang zhes bya ba ni skye mched bcu gnyis po rnams gzugs brnyan dang 'dra bas rang bzhin med pa nyid du khong du chud pa'o //
translated: The elimination of the sense-fields refers to the understanding that the twelve sense-fields are devoid of intrinsic reality, like a reflection.

original: srid pa spong ba dang zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la dmigs pa ni rjes su mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: srid pa spong ba dang zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la dmigs pa ni rjes su mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The abandonment of existence refers to the non-apprehension of all things which are perceived as empty by intrinsic nature.

original: mi skye ba mngon sum du byed pa zhes bya ba ni rang dang gzhan dang gnyi ga nyid ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes pas gdod nas skye ba med pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin khong du chud pa'o //
analyzed: mi skye ba mngon sum du byed pa zhes bya ba ni rang dang gzhan dang gnyi ga nyid ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes pas gdod nas skye ba med pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin khong du chud pa'o //
translated: The realization of non-production refers to the understanding of the nature of the realm of the Dharma, which is primordially non-production, by means of the intrinsic non-production of self, other and both.

original: byed pa la 'jug ces bya ba ni chos thams cad skye ba med par rtogs kyang sems can gyi don bya ba mi spong bar brtson 'grus brtsams pas 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: byed pa la 'jug ces bya ba ni chos thams cad skye ba med par rtogs kyang sems can gyi don bya ba mi spong bar brtson 'grus brtsams pas 'jug pa'o //
translated: The engagement in activity refers to the engagement in the practice of striving, without abandoning the benefit of sentient beings, even though one has realized that all things are non-produced.

original: rgyu gsal bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad sgra brnyan lta bur rig nas brag ca lta bu'i sgras byang chub kyi sems dang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa ston pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu gsal bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad sgra brnyan lta bur rig nas brag ca lta bu'i sgras byang chub kyi sems dang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa ston pa'o //
translated: The cause that makes things clear is that, having understood that all phenomena are like echoes, one teaches the thought of awakening and the perfection of generosity, and so forth, with a voice that is like an echo.

original: las kyi 'bras bu chud mi gson pa zhes bya ba ni rmi lam dang 'dra ba'i las rnams las 'bras bu yang rmi lam dang 'dra ba so sor nges pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: las kyi 'bras bu chud mi gson pa zhes bya ba ni rmi lam dang 'dra ba'i las rnams las 'bras bu yang rmi lam dang 'dra ba so sor nges pa nyid yin te /
translated: The result of actions is not lost is that, from actions that are like a dream, the results are also like a dream, and are individually certain.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because of the nature of dependent origination.

original: chos mthong ba zhes bya ba ni chos rnams mthong ba med pa nyid ni don dam par chos nyid mthong ba yin @10b pas chos mthong ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos mthong ba zhes bya ba ni chos rnams mthong ba med pa nyid ni don dam par chos nyid mthong ba yin @10b pas chos mthong ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Seeing phenomena is that the non-seeing of phenomena is the seeing of reality in the ultimate sense, and so it is called ‚Äúseeing phenomena.‚Äù

original: lam bsgom pa zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i ngo bo mi dmigs pa nyid kyis mngon par zhen pa med par bsgom par bya ba dang sgom pa po dang bsgom pa rjes su mi dmigs par sgom pa ni lam bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: lam bsgom pa zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i ngo bo mi dmigs pa nyid kyis mngon par zhen pa med par bsgom par bya ba dang sgom pa po dang bsgom pa rjes su mi dmigs par sgom pa ni lam bsgom pa'o //
translated: The path is cultivated means that the essence of the eightfold noble path is cultivated without manifest conceptualization, and the path is cultivated without the conceptualization of the one who cultivates, the cultivation, and the object of cultivation.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la brten pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis gsungs pa'i bslab pa yongs su skyong ba dang / chos nyid la nan tan byas pas sangs rgyas la brten par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la brten pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis gsungs pa'i bslab pa yongs su skyong ba dang / chos nyid la nan tan byas pas sangs rgyas la brten par 'gyur ro //
translated: The one who is supported by the Tathagata means that one is supported by the Buddha because one is intent on the precepts taught by all the Tathagatas and because one is intent on reality.

original: shes rab rno ba zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad skye ba med pa'i chos nyid zab mo la bzod pa so sor rtog pas sangs rgyas nyid mngon sum du byed pa'i shes rab ni rno ba nyid do //

translated: The one who has sharp wisdom means that one has sharp wisdom because one has the wisdom that realizes Buddhahood through the discernment of the acceptance of the profound reality of the non-production of all phenomena.

original: sems can rjes su 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa dang bag la nyal ba dang dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa la 'jug pa'i ye shes so //

translated: The knowledge of engaging sentient beings is the knowledge of the inclinations, dormant tendencies, and superior and inferior faculties of all sentient beings.

original: chos shes pa zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyi chos kyi sku'i ngo bor yongs su shes pas rjes su mi dmigs pa'i sbyor bas chos thams cad mthong ba ni chos mthong ba'o //

translated: The knowledge of seeing phenomena is the seeing of all phenomena by the application of non-apprehension, through the complete understanding of the essence of the Dharmakaya of all phenomena. Seeing phenomena is seeing the Dharma.

original: so sor yang dag par rig pa la 'jug pa shes pa ni chos dang don dang nges pa'i tshig dang spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa rnams la sems can rnams chos kyi tshul ji lta ba bzhin du nan tan byed cing 'dzud pa dang /üîΩbdag nyid kyang de bzhin du nan tan gyis yang dag par sgrub pa ni so so yang dag par rig pa la 'jug pa shes pa'o //

translated: The knowledge of engaging in discernment is the engagement in the discernment of phenomena, meaning, etymological definitions, and eloquence, through which one causes sentient beings to practice in accordance with the way of the Dharma, and also accomplishes it oneself through practice.

original: yi ge dang tshig rab tu dbye ba shes pa zhes bya ba ni aa la sogs pa'i yi ge rnams gdod nas ma skyes pa la sogs par rab tu 'byed pa ni yi ge'i rab tu dbye ba'o //üîΩtshig rab tu 'byed pa ni su ba dang dan ta'i dbye bas ming gi tshogs dang tshig gi tshogs dang / yi ge'i tshogs /

translated: The knowledge of the analysis of the Dharma is the knowledge of the analysis of the Dharma as it really is, which is the non-analytical ultimate.üîΩThe knowledge of the analysis of the ultimate is the knowledge of the analysis of the ultimate as it really is, which is the ultimate that is the object of the wisdom of the noble ones.üîΩThe knowledge of the analysis of the conventional is the knowledge of the analysis of the conventional as it really is, which is the conventional that is the object of the wisdom of the world.üîΩThe knowledge of the analysis of accomplishment is the knowledge of the analysis of accomplishment as it really is, which is the accomplishment of the wisdom of the noble ones.üîΩThe knowledge of the analysis of non-accomplishment is the knowledge of the analysis of non-accomplishment as it really is, which is the non-accomplishment of the wisdom of the world.üîΩThe knowledge of the analysis of the Dharma is the knowledge of the analysis of the Dharma as it really is, which is the Dharma of the noble ones.üîΩThe knowledge of the analysis of the non-Dharma is the knowledge of the analysis of the non-Dharma as it really is, which is the non-Dharma of the world.üîΩThe knowledge of the analysis of the past is the knowledge of the analysis of the past as it really is, which is the past of the Dharma.üîΩThe knowledge of the analysis of the future is the knowledge of the analysis of the future as it really is, which is the future of the Dharma.üîΩThe knowledge of the analysis of the present is the knowledge of the analysis of the present as it really is, which is the present of the Dharma.üîΩThe knowledge of the analysis of the unconditioned is the knowledge of the analysis of the unconditioned as it really is, which is the unconditioned of the Dharma.

original: mu stegs la sogs pas yongs su brtags pa rdzas dang yon tan dang las dang spyi dang bdag la sogs pa'i rdzas ma lus pa sgro btags pa tsam du shes nas mi zhen par yongs su gtang ba ni dngos po las yang dag par 'da' ba'o //

original: don du mi gnyer la ro mi myang ba nyid du sems can gyi don ched du byed pas 'dor bar yang mi byed pa ni skye bas chog shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: don du mi gnyer la ro mi myang ba nyid du sems can gyi don ched du byed pas 'dor bar yang mi byed pa ni skye bas chog shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúContent with whatever arises‚Äù means that, because one knows the nature of all that arises, one does not cling to it, does not pursue it, and does not savor it. And because one is working for the welfare of sentient beings, one does not reject it. This is called ‚Äúcontent with whatever arises.‚Äù

original: chos dkar pos mi ngoms pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas nyid thob par byed pa'i chos rnams nyan pa dang / sems pa dang sgom pas yongs su mi skyo ba dang / dkar po'i chos rnams gong nas gong du bsten pa dang / dge ba gang yin zhes tshol ba ni chos dkar pos mi ngoms pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos dkar pos mi ngoms pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas nyid thob par byed pa'i chos rnams nyan pa dang / sems pa dang sgom pas yongs su mi skyo ba dang / dkar po'i chos rnams gong nas gong du bsten pa dang / dge ba gang yin zhes tshol ba ni chos dkar pos mi ngoms pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Not being satisfied with the bright things means not being discouraged by listening to, reflecting on, and meditating on the teachings that lead to the attainment of Buddhahood, and by relying on the bright things more and more, and by seeking out what is wholesome. This is called not being satisfied with the bright things.

original: 'tsho ba rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni rigs pas rnyed pas chog shes shing /
analyzed: 'tsho ba rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni rigs pas rnyed pas chog shes shing /
translated: Pure livelihood means being content with what is righteously obtained,

original: rnyed pa'i ched du spyod lam bsrungs nas snyan par smra ba la sogs pa yongs su spong ba'i log pa'i 'tsho ba yongs su spangs pa ni 'tsho ba rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa'i ched du spyod lam bsrungs nas snyan par smra ba la sogs pa yongs su spong ba'i log pa'i 'tsho ba yongs su spangs pa ni 'tsho ba rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: and avoiding wrong livelihood, such as hypocrisy, flattery, hinting, belittling, pursuing gain through gain, not giving what should be given, and not making concessions to the poor. This is called pure livelihood.

original: dgon pa la gnas pa mi gtong ba zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sems dang bral ba'i sems yongs su mi gtong ba dang / yi dam du blangs pa mi spong ba dang / chos dben pa la mngon par dga' ba dang /
analyzed: dgon pa la gnas pa mi gtong ba zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sems dang bral ba'i sems yongs su mi gtong ba dang / yi dam du blangs pa mi spong ba dang / chos dben pa la mngon par dga' ba dang /
translated: ‚ÄúNot abandoning the solitary life‚Äù means not abandoning the attitude free of the thoughts of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas, not abandoning the vows one has taken, and delighting in the solitude of the Dharma.

original: bsam gtan la rtse gcig pa ni dgon pa la gnas pa mi gtong ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan la rtse gcig pa ni dgon pa la gnas pa mi gtong ba zhes bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOne-pointed concentration‚Äù means not abandoning the solitary life.

original: sa rnam par gzhag pa shes pa zhes bya ba ni nyan thos kyis dkar po rnam par mthong ba la sogs pa brgyad /
analyzed: sa rnam par gzhag pa shes pa zhes bya ba ni nyan thos kyis dkar po rnam par mthong ba la sogs pa brgyad /
translated: ‚ÄúKnowledge of the arrangement of the stages‚Äù means the eight stages of the ≈õrƒÅvakas, such as the stage of seeing what is bright,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa dang dgu /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa dang dgu /
translated: the stage of the pratyekabuddhas, and the nine stages,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa rab tu dga' ba nas chos kyi sprin gyi bar du bcu'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa rab tu dga' ba nas chos kyi sprin gyi bar du bcu'o //
translated: and the ten stages of the bodhisattvas, from the Joyous to the Cloud of Dharma.

original: de dag gi rnam par gzhag pa ni sa gang dag la dus ji srid du gnas nas yon tan ji snyed yod pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pas rnam pa thams @12a * //
analyzed: de dag gi rnam par gzhag pa ni sa gang dag la dus ji srid du gnas nas yon tan ji snyed yod pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pas rnam pa thams @12a * //
translated: ‚ÄúThe arrangement of the stages‚Äù means knowing exactly how many qualities there are on each stage, how long one stays on each stage, and so forth.

original: cad shes pa ni sa rnam par gzhag pa shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: cad shes pa ni sa rnam par gzhag pa shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of all is called the knowledge of the classification of the stages.

original: dran pa chud mi gson pa zhes bya ba ni nyan thos kyi mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang bdag med pa la sogs pa yongs su mi mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa chud mi gson pa zhes bya ba ni nyan thos kyi mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang bdag med pa la sogs pa yongs su mi mnyam pa'o //
translated: The non-forgetfulness of mindfulness is the non-forgetfulness of the impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and selflessness, etc. of the ≈õrƒÅvakas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba rnams dang / pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i dran pa mi nyams pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba rnams dang / pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i dran pa mi nyams pa'o //
translated: The non-forgetfulness of the emptiness, signlessness, wishlessness, natural luminosity, perfections, etc. of the bodhisattvas is called the non-forgetfulness of mindfulness.

original: phung po la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba nyid du rtogs pa dang / ngo bo med par rtogs pa la mkhas pa ni phung po la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phung po la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba nyid du rtogs pa dang / ngo bo med par rtogs pa la mkhas pa ni phung po la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The skill in the aggregates is the skill in realizing the aggregates, elements, and sense bases as dependently arisen and as essenceless. This is called the skill in the aggregates.

original: mngon par shes pa mngon sum du bya ba la 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang ba bzhi mngon sum du byas nas mngon par shes pa lnga nges par sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa mngon sum du bya ba la 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang ba bzhi mngon sum du byas nas mngon par shes pa lnga nges par sgrub pa'o //
translated: The entry into the realization of the superknowledges is the definite accomplishment of the five superknowledges after realizing the four bases of supernormal power.

original: de las rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul yang dag par bstan pas sems can dbang du byas pa ni mngon par shes pa mngon sum du bya ba la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de las rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul yang dag par bstan pas sems can dbang du byas pa ni mngon par shes pa mngon sum du bya ba la 'jug pa'o //
translated: The entry into the realization of the superknowledges is the control of sentient beings by demonstrating the miracle of supernormal power.

original: nyon mongs pa sel ba zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi rgyun chags pa dang / sdang ba dang rtag par lta ba byung ba'i gnyen po sgom pa ni nyon mongs pa sel ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa sel ba zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi rgyun chags pa dang / sdang ba dang rtag par lta ba byung ba'i gnyen po sgom pa ni nyon mongs pa sel ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The elimination of the afflictions is the meditation on the antidote to the arising of the continuous attachment, aversion, and delusion, and to the views of nihilism and eternalism. This is called the elimination of the afflictions.

original: bag chags kyis mtshams sbyor ba yang dag par 'joms pa zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi so so'i skye bo'i chos dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi bag chags rtsa ba nas spangs nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub chen por smon lam btab pa dang /
analyzed: bag chags kyis mtshams sbyor ba yang dag par 'joms pa zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi so so'i skye bo'i chos dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi bag chags rtsa ba nas spangs nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub chen por smon lam btab pa dang /
translated: The ‚Äúcomplete destruction of the latent tendencies‚Äù means that the Bodhisattvas have completely eliminated the latent tendencies of the former ordinary person stage and of the Hearer and Solitary-Realizer stages, and have made the vow for the great enlightenment.

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid sgom pa ni bag chags kyis mtshams sbyor ba yang dag par 'joms pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid sgom pa ni bag chags kyis mtshams sbyor ba yang dag par 'joms pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The meditation on the emptiness of all dharmas is called the ‚Äúcomplete destruction of the latent tendencies.‚Äù

original: khyad par du 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams nges par sgrub pa ni khyad par du 'gro ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: khyad par du 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams nges par sgrub pa ni khyad par du 'gro ba zhes bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúProgress‚Äù means the definite accomplishment of the powers, the fearlessnesses, the specific knowledges, and the unshared dharmas of all the TathƒÅgatas.

original: bsgoms pa'i rgyu mthun pa zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba spangs pa ni bsgoms pa'i rgyu mthun pa zhes bya'o //üîΩnyes pa las 'byung ba la mkhas pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i rgyu mthun pa zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba spangs pa ni bsgoms pa'i rgyu mthun pa zhes bya'o // nyes pa las 'byung ba la mkhas pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The concordance with meditation is the abandonment of attachment and aversion through the power of meditating on the equality of all phenomena.

original: so sor thar pa'i 'dul ba las bstan pa'i bslab pa'i gnas kyi bye brag las 'das pa rnams @12b las ldang bar bya ba la mkhas pa ni nyes pa las 'byung ba la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i 'dul ba las bstan pa'i bslab pa'i gnas kyi bye brag las 'das pa rnams @12b las ldang bar bya ba la mkhas pa ni nyes pa las 'byung ba la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The skill in emerging from faults is the skill in emerging from the various categories of precepts taught in the Vinaya of the Pratimoksha.

original: kun nas ldang ba gnon pa zhes bya ba ni mi dge ba sngon byas pa'i nyes pa 'chags shing yang mi byed pa'i sdom pa yang dag par len pa dang / gnyen po'i phyogs sgom pa ni kun nas ldang ba gnon pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kun nas ldang ba gnon pa zhes bya ba ni mi dge ba sngon byas pa'i nyes pa 'chags shing yang mi byed pa'i sdom pa yang dag par len pa dang / gnyen po'i phyogs sgom pa ni kun nas ldang ba gnon pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The suppression of the emergence is the confession of the faults of non-virtue previously committed, the vow not to commit them again, and the cultivation of the antidote.

original: bag la nyal spong ba zhes bya ba ni khams gsum gyi skye ba la sred cing dga' ba'i 'khri shing rgyas pa rtsa ba nas gcod cing sel ba dang / chos thams cad la sred pa rab tu spangs pa ni bag la nyal spangs pa'o //
analyzed: bag la nyal spong ba zhes bya ba ni khams gsum gyi skye ba la sred cing dga' ba'i 'khri shing rgyas pa rtsa ba nas gcod cing sel ba dang / chos thams cad la sred pa rab tu spangs pa ni bag la nyal spangs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúElimination of latent tendencies‚Äù means to cut the root of the creeper of craving and delight in the births of the three realms, and to eliminate them, and to completely abandon craving for all phenomena.

original: srid pa las yang dag par 'da' ba zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i rgyu ma rig pa dang srid pa yang dag par spangs pa dang / khams gsum pa'i yid la byed pa las yang dag par 'das pa ni srid pa las yang dag par 'da' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: srid pa las yang dag par 'da' ba zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i rgyu ma rig pa dang srid pa yang dag par spangs pa dang / khams gsum pa'i yid la byed pa las yang dag par 'das pa ni srid pa las yang dag par 'da' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTranscendence of existence‚Äù means to completely abandon ignorance, which is the cause of existence, and existence itself, and to transcend the mental activity of the three realms. This is called ‚Äútranscendence of existence.‚Äù

original: skye ba dran pa zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i mngon par shes pa'i stobs kyis skye ba brgyud pa dpag tu med pa mngon par dran pa ni skye ba dran pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba dran pa zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i mngon par shes pa'i stobs kyis skye ba brgyud pa dpag tu med pa mngon par dran pa ni skye ba dran pa zhes bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúRecollection of past lives‚Äù means to recollect the succession of births through the power of the superknowledge of recollecting past lives. This is called ‚Äúrecollection of past lives.‚Äù

original: las kyi rnam par smin pa la nem nur med pa zhes bya ba ni rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtha' gnyis dang bral ba'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos nyid khong du chud pas las dang rnam par smin pa la the tshom med pa ni las kyi
analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pa la nem nur med pa zhes bya ba ni rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtha' gnyis dang bral ba'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos nyid khong du chud pas las dang rnam par smin pa la the tshom med pa ni las kyi
translated: ‚ÄúNo hesitation about the evolution of karma‚Äù means that, because of comprehending the reality of dependent origination, which is free from the two extremes of eternalism and nihilism, one has no doubt about karma and its evolution.

original: rnam par smin pa la nem nur med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa la nem nur med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called ‚Äúno hesitation about the evolution of karma.‚Äù

original: chos sems pa zhes bya ba ni chos nyid dang / de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' rnams ni de bzhin gshegs pa byung yang rung ma byung yang rung chos rnams kyi chos nyid 'di ni de bzhin du gnas pa yin pas chos zhes bya ba'i sgras chos nyid bstan la /
analyzed: chos sems pa zhes bya ba ni chos nyid dang / de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' rnams ni de bzhin gshegs pa byung yang rung ma byung yang rung chos rnams kyi chos nyid 'di ni de bzhin du gnas pa yin pas chos zhes bya ba'i sgras chos nyid bstan la /
translated: ‚ÄúThinking about the Dharma‚Äù means that the reality, the suchness, and the ultimate of all things are just as they are, whether a TathƒÅgata appears or not. Therefore, the word ‚ÄúDharma‚Äù indicates reality.

original: de la sems pa dang sgom pa dang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu rtog pa ni chos sems pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la sems pa dang sgom pa dang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu rtog pa ni chos sems pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thinking about that, meditating on it, and correctly discerning it is called ‚Äúthinking about the Dharma.‚Äù

original: thos pa tshol ba zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan rgya cher ston pa'i khyad par rtogs pa tshol zhing /
analyzed: thos pa tshol ba zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan rgya cher ston pa'i khyad par rtogs pa tshol zhing /
translated: Seeking learning means seeking the realization of the distinctions that extensively teach the qualities of the ≈õrƒÅvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and bodhisattvas.

original: sde snod gsum dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod dang / shin tu rgyas pa rmad gcad nyan zhing don gyi khyad par tshol ba ni thos pa tshol ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sde snod gsum dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod dang / shin tu rgyas pa rmad gcad nyan zhing don gyi khyad par tshol ba ni thos pa tshol ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Listening to the three pi·π≠akas, the bodhisattva pi·π≠aka, and the vaipulya and avadƒÅna, and seeking the distinctions of their meaning is called seeking learning.

original: ye shes rno ba zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bu dang / rmi lam lta bu dang / rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ni ye shes rno ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ye shes rno ba zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bu dang / rmi lam lta bu dang / rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ni ye shes rno ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Sharp wisdom means all phenomena are like illusions, like dreams, and are naturally empty, and so on. This is called sharp wisdom.

original: ye shes la sred pa zhes bya ba ni gong ma gong ma'i ye shes kyi sa ba'i chos nyid rtogs pa'i ye shes @13a * //
analyzed: ye shes la sred pa zhes bya ba ni gong ma gong ma'i ye shes kyi sa ba'i chos nyid rtogs pa'i ye shes @13a * //
translated: Craving wisdom means seeking the wisdom that realizes the nature of the phenomena of higher and higher wisdom.

original: tshol ba ni ye shes la sred pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshol ba ni ye shes la sred pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called craving wisdom.

original: ye shes rjes su rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon du mdzad pa'i ye shes dang / de skyed par byed pa'i lam gyi ye shes rtogs pas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ye shes rtogs pa ni ye shes rjes su rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ye shes rjes su rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon du mdzad pa'i ye shes dang / de skyed par byed pa'i lam gyi ye shes rtogs pas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ye shes rtogs pa ni ye shes rjes su rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The realization of intuition is the intuition that realizes the intuition of the result, the intuition that realizes the intuition of the cause, the intuition that realizes the intuition of the path, and the intuition that realizes the intuition of the result.

original: cang shes kyi sa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: cang shes kyi sa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The stage of the well-trained,

original: cang shes ni lnga ste /
analyzed: cang shes ni lnga ste /
translated: The well-trained are five:

original: glang po che dang / rta dang / glang dang / seng ge dang / nyan thos rnams te /
analyzed: glang po che dang / rta dang / glang dang / seng ge dang / nyan thos rnams te /
translated: elephants, horses, bulls, lions, and disciples.

original: 'jigs pa dang bral ba nyid dang / dul ba nyid kyis so //
analyzed: 'jigs pa dang bral ba nyid dang / dul ba nyid kyis so //
translated: They are well-trained because they are fearless and well-disciplined.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni cang shes chen po ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni cang shes chen po ste /
translated: Bodhisattvas are the most well-trained of all,

original: lam drang po nas 'gro ba nyid kyi phyir dang / 'jigs pa thams cad yang dag par spangs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: lam drang po nas 'gro ba nyid kyi phyir dang / 'jigs pa thams cad yang dag par spangs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because they go by the straight path and because they are free from all fear.

original: de dag gi sa ni rab tu dga' ba la sog pa sa bcu'o //
analyzed: de dag gi sa ni rab tu dga' ba la sog pa sa bcu'o //
translated: Their stage is the ten stages, the Joyous and so on.

original: de dag la bslabs pas yon tan thams cad des par skyed par byed pas sa ste /
analyzed: de dag la bslabs pas yon tan thams cad des par skyed par byed pas sa ste /
translated: Since all good qualities are generated by training in them, they are stages.

original: cang shes kyis sa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: cang shes kyis sa zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called stages of the thoroughbred.

original: sems ri lta bu zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems ri lta bu zhes bya ba la /
translated: The mind is like a mountain.

original: bdud dang mu stegs pa thams cad kyi mi bskyod pa dang / byang chub chen por sems brtan pa ri'i rgyal po ri rab ltar mi g-yo bar byang chub kyi snying po la bzhugs nas kyang lha'i bu'i bdud la sogs pa bdud bzhis mngon par mi g-yo ba'i thugs de'i ngo bo ni sems ri rab lta bu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdud dang mu stegs pa thams cad kyi mi bskyod pa dang / byang chub chen por sems brtan pa ri'i rgyal po ri rab ltar mi g-yo bar byang chub kyi snying po la bzhugs nas kyang lha'i bu'i bdud la sogs pa bdud bzhis mngon par mi g-yo ba'i thugs de'i ngo bo ni sems ri rab lta bu zhes bya'o //
translated: The essence of the mind that is unshaken by all demons and non-Buddhists, and that is firm in the great enlightenment, is like the unshaken king of mountains, Mount Meru. Even while seated at the site of awakening, the mind is not shaken by the four demons, such as the demon of the sons of the gods.

original: mi bsgul ba zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i rlung thams cad kyis yang dag par mi 'phrogs pas mi bsgul ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi bsgul ba zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i rlung thams cad kyis yang dag par mi 'phrogs pas mi bsgul ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is unshakable because it is not at all disturbed by any of the winds of afflictions.

original: mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: The mind is immovable.

original: phyi dang nang gi mtshan ma rnams yid la mi byed pas /
analyzed: phyi dang nang gi mtshan ma rnams yid la mi byed pas /
translated: Since it does not attend to the signs of the internal and external,

original: rjes su mi dmigs pa ni mi g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su mi dmigs pa ni mi g-yo ba'o //

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni gang gis phyir mi ldog par mtshon pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang ma bral ba nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mthong ba dang / bsnyen bkur byas pa dang / des gsungs pa'i chos thos pa dang /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni gang gis phyir mi ldog par mtshon pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang ma bral ba nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mthong ba dang / bsnyen bkur byas pa dang / des gsungs pa'i chos thos pa dang /
translated: The ‚Äúdefinition of irreversibility‚Äù is the indivisibility of the six perfections that define irreversibility.üîΩ

original: bsgom pa dang mi 'bral ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa ni phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa dang mi 'bral ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa ni phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The characteristic of irreversibility is the non-separation from the six perfections that are the signs of irreversibility, and the bodhisattva conduct that is not separated from seeing all the tathƒÅgatas, serving them, hearing the Dharma they teach,üîΩand meditating on it.

original: dkar po'i chos mngon par rdzogs par 'byor ba zhes bya ba la dkar po'i chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs pas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang nye bar gyur cing /
analyzed: dkar po'i chos mngon par rdzogs par 'byor ba zhes bya ba la dkar po'i chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs pas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang nye bar gyur cing /
translated: The full accomplishment of the bright dharmas is the full accomplishment of all the bright dharmas, which is the approach to perfect enlightenment,

original: dkar po'i chos mngon par rdzogs par 'byor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dkar po'i chos mngon par rdzogs par 'byor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: and is called the full accomplishment of the bright dharmas.

original: sdig pa'i chos la smod pa zhes bya ba ni sdig pa'i chos kyi rnam par @13b smin pa yongs su shes pas dang po nas kyang sdig pa'i las mi byed la /
analyzed: sdig pa'i chos la smod pa zhes bya ba ni sdig pa'i chos kyi rnam par @13b smin pa yongs su shes pas dang po nas kyang sdig pa'i las mi byed la /
translated: The phrase to condemn evil means that, by understanding the consequences of evil, one does not commit evil deeds from the very beginning.

original: byas pa rnams kyang 'chags shing phyin chad kyang mi byed par yang dag par sdom pa ni sdig pa'i chos la smod pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: byas pa rnams kyang 'chags shing phyin chad kyang mi byed par yang dag par sdom pa ni sdig pa'i chos la smod pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: And, if one does commit them, one confesses them and does not commit them again in the future. This is called to condemn evil.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rgyu ba med pa zhes bya ba la ma rig pa dang sred pa dang 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug rnams mi skyed pa dang / yid la mi byed pa ni nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rgyu ba med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rgyu ba med pa zhes bya ba la ma rig pa dang sred pa dang 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug rnams mi skyed pa dang / yid la mi byed pa ni nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rgyu ba med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The phrase to be free from the activity of the mental afflictions means that one does not generate ignorance, craving, desire, hatred, or delusion, and one does not pay attention to them. This is called to be free from the activity of the mental afflictions.

original: bslab pa yongs su mi gtong ba zhes bya ba ni las dang 'bras bu nges par 'brel bar rtogs pas bden pa dang dkon mchog la yid ches pa bstan pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la gus pa ni bslab pa yongs su mi gtong ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bslab pa yongs su mi gtong ba zhes bya ba ni las dang 'bras bu nges par 'brel bar rtogs pas bden pa dang dkon mchog la yid ches pa bstan pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la gus pa ni bslab pa yongs su mi gtong ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Not abandoning the training is taught by the faith in the truths and the Jewels through understanding the definite connection between actions and their results.

original: ting nge 'dzin la rnam par 'jog pa zhes bya ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams skye zhing 'gag pa'i ngo bo la rtogs pa la mkhas pa dang ma tshang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams la sems rtse gcig pa ni ting nge 'dzin
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la rnam par 'jog pa zhes bya ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams skye zhing 'gag pa'i ngo bo la rtogs pa la mkhas pa dang ma tshang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams la sems rtse gcig pa ni ting nge 'dzin
translated: Arranging the mind in meditative concentration is the one-pointed mind in the meditative concentrations that are not incomplete and are skilled in the realization of the nature of the arising and ceasing of the mind and mental factors.

original: la rnam par 'jog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: la rnam par 'jog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called ‚Äúarranging the mind in meditative concentration.‚Äù

original: sems can rnams kyi bsam pa shes pa zhes bya ba ni dman pa dang 'bring dang mchog gi dbang po'i dbye ba tha dad pa'i sems can rnams kyi bsam pa shes nas de dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi bsam pa shes pa zhes bya ba ni dman pa dang 'bring dang mchog gi dbang po'i dbye ba tha dad pa'i sems can rnams kyi bsam pa shes nas de dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Knowing the thoughts of sentient beings is knowing the thoughts of sentient beings who are differentiated by the categories of inferior, middling and superior faculties and then teaching them the Dharma in accordance with that.

original: dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa ni sems can gyi bsam pa shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa ni sems can gyi bsam pa shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Knowledge of the best and the not best faculties is called knowledge of the inclinations of beings.

original: skye ba'i khyad par shes pa zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba rigs lnga rnams kyi 'khor bar gang du skyes nas sems can rnams kyi don du 'gyur ba der byang chub sems dpa' rnams bsams bzhin du skye ba len pa'i shes pa ni skye ba'i khyad par shesüîΩpa zhes bya'o //üîΩshes pa mtha' yas pa shes pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i las kyi gnas dang / bzo'i gnas shes pa de'i khyad par nyid dbye ba dpag tu med pa shes pa ni shes pa mtha' yas pa shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba'i khyad par shes pa zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba rigs lnga rnams kyi 'khor bar gang du skyes nas sems can rnams kyi don du 'gyur ba der byang chub sems dpa' rnams bsams bzhin du skye ba len pa'i shes pa ni skye ba'i khyad par shes pa zhes bya'o // shes pa mtha' yas pa shes pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i las kyi gnas dang / bzo'i gnas shes pa de'i khyad par nyid dbye ba dpag tu med pa shes pa ni shes pa mtha' yas pa shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Knowledge of the different aspirations is the knowledge of the Bodhisattvas that they take birth intentionally in any place of the five realms of cyclic existence, in order to benefit beings.üîΩKnowledge of the infinite is the knowledge of the Bodhisattvas that they know the infinite varieties of the mundane and supramundane crafts and skills.üîΩKnowledge of the different dispositions is the knowledge of the Bodhisattvas that they know the different dispositions of beings.üîΩKnowledge of the different elements is the knowledge of the Bodhisattvas that they know the different elements of beings.

original: tshig gi dgongs pa shes pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tshig gi dgongs pa shes pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Knowledge of the paths that lead everywhere is the knowledge of the Bodhisattvas that they know the paths that lead to the different realms of cyclic existence and beyond it.üîΩKnowledge of former lives is the knowledge of the Bodhisattvas that they remember their former abodes.üîΩKnowledge of death and rebirth is the knowledge of the Bodhisattvas that they see the deaths and rebirths of beings.üîΩKnowledge of the cessation of contaminants is the knowledge of the Bodhisattvas that they know the cessation of contaminants.üîΩKnowledge of the Dharma is the knowledge of the Bodhisattvas that they know the Dharma.üîΩKnowledge of the different words is the knowledge of the Bodhisattvas that they know the different languages of beings.

original: sems can gyi bsam pa la dgongs pa dang / bstan pa la dgongs pa dang / don gzhan la dgongs pa dang / dus gzhan la dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi bsam pa la dgongs pa dang / bstan pa la dgongs pa dang / don gzhan la dgongs pa dang / dus gzhan la dgongs pa'o //
translated: The intention with regard to the thoughts of sentient beings, the intention with regard to the teaching, the intention with regard to another meaning, and the intention with regard to another time.

original: de dang de la dgongs nas bstan pa'i dgongs pa can gyi tshig de dang de rtogs pa'i shes pa ni tshig gi dgongs pa shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dang de la dgongs nas bstan pa'i dgongs pa can gyi tshig de dang de rtogs pa'i shes pa ni tshig gi dgongs pa shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The knowledge that understands the words that are the intention of the teaching, intending this and that, is called the knowledge of the intention of the words.

original: khyim na gnas pa yongs @14a * //
analyzed: khyim na gnas pa yongs @14a * //
translated: Renunciation of the household life.

original: su gtang ba zhes bya ba la lus dang ngag dang sems dben pa dang / chags pa thams cad yongs su spangs nas rab tu byung nas nges par 'byung ba'i sems ni khyim na gnas pa yongs su gtang ba zhes bya'o //üîΩkhams gsum la mngon par mi dga' ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: su gtang ba zhes bya ba la lus dang ngag dang sems dben pa dang / chags pa thams cad yongs su spangs nas rab tu byung nas nges par 'byung ba'i sems ni khyim na gnas pa yongs su gtang ba zhes bya'o // khams gsum la mngon par mi dga' ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: Renunciation of the household life is the mind of renunciation, having given up the body, speech, and mind, and having gone forth, having given up all attachments.üîΩDiscontent with the three realms.

original: khams gsum gyi rang gi ngo bo rtog pas mngon par zhen pa med pa dang / mi dmigs pa'i sbyor bas khams gsum la mngon par mi dga' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: khams gsum gyi rang gi ngo bo rtog pas mngon par zhen pa med pa dang / mi dmigs pa'i sbyor bas khams gsum la mngon par mi dga' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Discontent with the three realms is the absence of conceptual attachment to the intrinsic nature of the three realms, and the absence of delight in the three realms through the application of non-apprehension.

original: sems zhum pa med pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems zhum pa med pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: 1. He has an indefatigable mind.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dpag tu med pa bsags pa'i rgyur gyur pa byang chub kyi sems mi gtong ba dang / rtag tu yang dag par blangs pa mi gtong ba'i sems ni sems zhum pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dpag tu med pa bsags pa'i rgyur gyur pa byang chub kyi sems mi gtong ba dang / rtag tu yang dag par blangs pa mi gtong ba'i sems ni sems zhum pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He never gives up the Thought of Enlightenment, which is the cause of the accumulation of the immeasurable collections of merit and knowledge, and he never gives up the mind of the constant and correct practice. This is called ‚Äúan indefatigable mind.‚Äù

original: chos la mngon par zhen pa med pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos la mngon par zhen pa med pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: 2. He is not attached to the Dharma.

original: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du mthong bas chos thams cad la mngon par zhen pa med par 'jug pa ni chos la mngon par zhen pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du mthong bas chos thams cad la mngon par zhen pa med par 'jug pa ni chos la mngon par zhen pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He enters into the non-attachment to all dharmas by seeing the sameness of all dharmas. This is called ‚Äúnot being attached to the Dharma.‚ÄùüîΩ3. He upholds the holy Dharma.

original: dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa zhes bya ba la sangs rgyas kyi byang chub thob par byed pa'i chos rnams mi gtong ba'i sems kyis yang dag par len pa ni dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa zhes bya ba la sangs rgyas kyi byang chub thob par byed pa'i chos rnams mi gtong ba'i sems kyis yang dag par len pa ni dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He takes up the dharmas that bring about the attainment of the enlightenment of the Buddhas with a mind that does not give them up. This is called ‚Äúupholding the holy Dharma.‚Äù

original: chos srung ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos srung ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: 4. He protects the Dharma.

original: dam pa'i chos sun 'byin pa rnams dang / gzhan gyi phyogs ngan par smra ba rnams rigs pas tshar bcad nas rang gi phyogs su 'jog pa ni chos srung ba zhes bya'o //üîΩlas kyi rnam par smin pa la yid ches pa zhes bya ba ni rang dang gzhan la ngo tsha bas sdig pa'i las spong zhing mi dge bas dmyal ba la sogs par 'gro ba yid ches shing /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos sun 'byin pa rnams dang / gzhan gyi phyogs ngan par smra ba rnams rigs pas tshar bcad nas rang gi phyogs su 'jog pa ni chos srung ba zhes bya'o // las kyi rnam par smin pa la yid ches pa zhes bya ba ni rang dang gzhan la ngo tsha bas sdig pa'i las spong zhing mi dge bas dmyal ba la sogs par 'gro ba yid ches shing /
translated: To refute those who disparage the holy Dharma and to refute those who speak ill of other positions, and to establish one's own position by means of reasoning, is called defending the Dharma.

original: dge bas lha dang mir skye bar yid ches pas de'i phyir rtag tu chos tshol ba la mngon par sbyor ba ni las kyi rnam par smin pa la yid ches pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge bas lha dang mir skye bar yid ches pas de'i phyir rtag tu chos tshol ba la mngon par sbyor ba ni las kyi rnam par smin pa la yid ches pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Faith in the ripening of karma means to avoid sinful actions out of shame before oneself and others, and to have faith in the non-virtuous path to the hells, etc., and to have faith in the virtuous path to rebirth as a god or human. Therefore, to always apply oneself to seeking the Dharma is called faith in the ripening of karma.

original: 'dul ba la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba mi 'byung ba dang / ltung ba'i khyad par dge 'dun gyi lhag ma la sogs pa sbom po'i gnas rtogs pa ni 'dul ba la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dul ba la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba mi 'byung ba dang / ltung ba'i khyad par dge 'dun gyi lhag ma la sogs pa sbom po'i gnas rtogs pa ni 'dul ba la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Skill in the Vinaya means to not commit naturally reprehensible actions, and to understand the distinctions of downfalls, such as the serious offenses of the Sa·πÖgha, etc. This is called skill in the Vinaya.

original: rtsod pa'i gzhi zhi bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni tshogs kyi nang na gnas na ni nges par rtsod pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba ni rtsod pa'i gzhi yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsod pa'i gzhi zhi bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni tshogs kyi nang na gnas na ni nges par rtsod pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba ni rtsod pa'i gzhi yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The basis of dispute is pacified means that when one dwells in the assembly, disputes certainly arise because the basis of dispute exists.

original: de'i phyir tshogs dang 'du 'dzi rnam par spangs pa ni rtsod pa'i gzhi zhi bar byed pa zhes bya'o //üîΩ'gyed pa med @14b pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshogs dang 'du 'dzi rnam par spangs pa ni rtsod pa'i gzhi zhi bar byed pa zhes bya'o // 'gyed pa med @14b pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Therefore, the abandonment of the assembly and of distraction is called the pacification of the basis of dispute.

original: 'jig rten pa'i 'gyed pa'i gzhi las byung ba'i rnam par spros pa spong zhing 'gyed pa med pa ni mi rtsod pa ste dge sbyong gi chos 'gyed pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i 'gyed pa'i gzhi las byung ba'i rnam par spros pa spong zhing 'gyed pa med pa ni mi rtsod pa ste dge sbyong gi chos 'gyed pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: There is no contention means that one abandons the proliferation that arises from the basis of mundane contention and is without contention, which is called the Dharma of the spiritual practitioner that is without contention.

original: bzod pa'i sa zhes bya ba ni lus dang sems la gnod pa chos nyid kyi stobs kyis bzod pa ni bzod pa'i sa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bzod pa'i sa zhes bya ba ni lus dang sems la gnod pa chos nyid kyi stobs kyis bzod pa ni bzod pa'i sa zhes bya'o //
translated: The stage of patient acceptance means that the patient acceptance of harm to body and mind through the power of reality is called the stage of patient acceptance.

original: bzod pa yang dag par 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang du len pa dang / gzhan gnod pa byed pa la ji mi snyam pa dang chos la nges par rtogs pa'i bzod pa blangs nas rtag tu goms par byed pa dang / gzhan ngan du smra ba dang /
analyzed: bzod pa yang dag par 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang du len pa dang / gzhan gnod pa byed pa la ji mi snyam pa dang chos la nges par rtogs pa'i bzod pa blangs nas rtag tu goms par byed pa dang / gzhan ngan du smra ba dang /
translated: Correct acceptance of patience is the constant practice of the patience of accepting suffering, of not retaliating against those who harm others, and of ascertaining the Dharma, after one has taken up these three kinds of patience.

original: ring nas 'ongs pa'i tshig gi lam rnams btang snyoms su byas nas bzod pa ma ral bar byed pa ni bzod pa yang dag par 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: ring nas 'ongs pa'i tshig gi lam rnams btang snyoms su byas nas bzod pa ma ral bar byed pa ni bzod pa yang dag par 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Correct acceptance of patience is the nondefective patience of one who is indifferent to the paths of speech of those who speak ill of him, and of those who come from afar.

original: chos rab tu 'byed pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa'i dbye ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyi rab tu dbye bas mi dmigs pa nyid ni chos rab tu dbye ba la mkhas pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: chos rab tu 'byed pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa'i dbye ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyi rab tu dbye bas mi dmigs pa nyid ni chos rab tu dbye ba la mkhas pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Skill in discerning the dharmas is the nondiscernment of the divisions of the aggregates, elements, sense-fields, etc., and of the divisions of the side of affliction and the side of purification. This is called skill in discerning the dharmas.

original: chos gtan la dbab pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ni chos thams cad brjod du med pa dang / gdod nas ma skyes pa'i rang bzhin du rnam par nges pa'i shes pa ni chos gtan la dbab pa la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //üîΩchos kyi tshig rab tu dbye ba shes pa zhes bya ba ni phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang byang chub kyi yan lag la sogs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa shes pa ni chos kyi tshig rab tu dbye ba shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos gtan la dbab pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ni chos thams cad brjod du med pa dang / gdod nas ma skyes pa'i rang bzhin du rnam par nges pa'i shes pa ni chos gtan la dbab pa la mkhas pa zhes bya'o // chos kyi tshig rab tu dbye ba shes pa zhes bya ba ni phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang byang chub kyi yan lag la sogs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa shes pa ni chos kyi tshig rab tu dbye ba shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Skill in determining phenomena is the cognition that ascertains all phenomena to be inexpressible and primordially unborn by nature.üîΩSkill in the knowledge of the classification of the words of the Dharma is the knowledge of the presentation of the aggregates, elements, sense bases, dependent origination, bases of spiritual power, faculties, powers, branches of enlightenment, and so forth.

original: chos kyi tshig nges par dgod pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni chos rnams kyi tshig rab tu gnas pa ni de bzhin nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba ste /
analyzed: chos kyi tshig nges par dgod pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni chos rnams kyi tshig rab tu gnas pa ni de bzhin nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba ste /
translated: Skill in the arrangement of the words of the Dharma is the abiding of the words of the Dharma in suchness, the classification of suchness.

original: stong pa nyid bcu drug la sogs pa'i rab tu dbye bas rab tu ston pa'i shes pa ni chos kyi tshig nges par dgod pa la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid bcu drug la sogs pa'i rab tu dbye bas rab tu ston pa'i shes pa ni chos kyi tshig nges par dgod pa la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The knowledge that teaches through the analysis of the sixteen kinds of emptiness and so on is called the skill in positing the words of the Dharma.

original: don dang don ma yin pa'i tshig gi dbye ba dgod pa la mkhas pa'i shes pa zhes bya ba la don ni chos so //
analyzed: don dang don ma yin pa'i tshig gi dbye ba dgod pa la mkhas pa'i shes pa zhes bya ba la don ni chos so //
translated: The knowledge of the skill in positing the division of words that are meaningful and meaningless is called the knowledge of the skill in positing the division of words that are meaningful and meaningless. Meaning is Dharma.

original: don ma yin pa ni chos ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: don ma yin pa ni chos ma yin pa'o //
translated: Meaningless is non-Dharma.

original: don dang don ma yin pa de dag gnyis ka la bsnan pa med cing dbri ba med pa dang / chos nyid mnyam pa nyid la so sor bsnan du med pa nyid ni chos thams cad yongs su shes pa ste /
analyzed: don dang don ma yin pa de dag gnyis ka la bsnan pa med cing dbri ba med pa dang / chos nyid mnyam pa nyid la so sor bsnan du med pa nyid ni chos thams cad yongs su shes pa ste /
translated: The non-addition and non-subtraction of both meaning and meaningless, and the non-addition of the sameness of reality to all dharmas is the full understanding of all dharmas.

original: dbye ba med pa'i gnas ni chos thams cad gnyis @15a * //üîΩsu med pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: dbye ba med pa'i gnas ni chos thams cad gnyis @15a * // su med pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The non-differentiated state is the suchness of all dharmas without duality.

original: de la mkhas pa ni gsal ba ste /
analyzed: de la mkhas pa ni gsal ba ste /
translated: Skill in that is clarity.

original: blang ba dang dor ba'i cha shes pa ni don dang don ma yin pa la mkhas pa shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: blang ba dang dor ba'i cha shes pa ni don dang don ma yin pa la mkhas pa shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of the part that is to be taken up and the part that is to be put aside is called the knowledge of the skill in positing the division of words that are meaningful and meaningless.

original: sngon gyi mtha' shes pa ni sngon gyi mtha' ste rgyu dang byed pa yin no //
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' shes pa ni sngon gyi mtha' ste rgyu dang byed pa yin no //
translated: Knowledge of the prior limit is the prior limit, i.e., the cause and the activity.

original: phyi ma'i mtha' ni bya ba ste 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' ni bya ba ste 'bras bu yin no //
translated: The subsequent limit is the activity, i.e., the result.

original: de la rgyu ni byang chub kyi sems te sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la rgyu ni byang chub kyi sems te sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi byed pa'o //
translated: The cause is the thought of enlightenment, the activity of the dharmas of the Buddha.

original: 'bras bu ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyid do //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyid do //
translated: The result is the state of the Sravaka, Pratyekabuddha, and the perfect Buddha.

original: de'i rang gi ngo bo ji lta ba rig pa ni sngon gyi mtha' shes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rang gi ngo bo ji lta ba rig pa ni sngon gyi mtha' shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the nature of that is the knowledge of the prior limit.

translated: Skill in means refers to the dedication of even the smallest roots of virtue, such as the confession of sins, rejoicing in merit, requesting the Buddhas to teach, and beseeching them not to pass into Nirvana, which are made common to all sentient beings and thus become immeasurable.

original: mtshan ma spong ba zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad rmi lam lta bu'o zhes rtogs nas dngos po'i rang bzhin med pas @20b rdzas su gyur pa'i mtshan ma mi dmigs pa ni mtshan ma spong ba zhes bya'o //

translated: The bodhisattva's ascertainment of the truth is the non-abandonment of cyclic existence even though name-and-form, etc., are not produced and the continuum along with its residual impressions is abandoned.

translated: The manifestation of liberation is the experience of the non-apprehension of the nature of the object of abandonment through being freed from all afflictions without exception. This is called the manifestation of liberation.

original: tshig mgo gcig tu smra ba zhes bya ba ni mu stegs kyi gzhung sna tshogs kyis brtags pa'i lta ba bsal nas chos thams cad bdag med par rab tu sgrub pa ni tshig mgo gcig tu smra ba zhes bya ba'o ;

translated: The phrase attains fearlessness means that one attains the result of fearlessness, which is to say, fearlessness in listening to the profound teachings of the Buddha, fearlessness in putting them into practice, fearlessness in refuting the objections of others, and fearlessness in proclaiming one‚Äôs own realization.

translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe highest moral discipline‚Äù refers to the essence of moral discipline, which is to say, the ten virtuous deeds, the acceptance of the vows of individual liberation, and the avoidance of all that is nonvirtuous.

analyzed: ngo bo'i rkyen yin na yang thams cad dang rang gi ngo bo nyid brjod par bya'o //
translated: Even when the essence is the condition, all of the essence must be stated, not just a part of it.

original: chos gzhan la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: chos gzhan la ni ma yin no //
translated: This is not the case with other dharmas.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa la gzhol ba zhes bya ba ni khams gsum ma lus pa la mngon par mi dga' zhing bden pa la dga' ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la dga' ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mngon par 'dod pa ni ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa'i rgyu yin no //üîΩshes rab thob pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa la gzhol ba zhes bya ba ni khams gsum ma lus pa la mngon par mi dga' zhing bden pa la dga' ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la dga' ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mngon par 'dod pa ni ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa'i rgyu yin no // shes rab thob pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The expression inclined toward meditative concentration means that one is not at all fond of the three realms of existence, but is fond of the truth, is fond of nirvana, and is intent on omniscience. This is the cause of meditative concentration.

original: pha rol smra ba ma lus pa'i lta ba sun 'don nus pa'i shes pa thob pa dang / dmigs pa thams cad snang ba med pa'i shes pa ni shes rab thob pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pha rol smra ba ma lus pa'i lta ba sun 'don nus pa'i shes pa thob pa dang / dmigs pa thams cad snang ba med pa'i shes pa ni shes rab thob pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The expression attains wisdom means that one attains the wisdom that is able to refute the views of all opponents, and the wisdom that is free from the appearance of all objects. This is called attains wisdom.

original: gcig pur dga' zhes bya ba ni 'du 'dzi thams cad spangs nas dkar po'i chos mdor byas pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa ni gcig pu dga' ba zhes bya'o //üîΩshes kyi khe chung dus chog shes pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gcig pur dga' zhes bya ba ni 'du 'dzi thams cad spangs nas dkar po'i chos mdor byas pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa ni gcig pu dga' ba zhes bya'o //üîΩshes kyi khe chung dus chog shes pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The expression delights in solitude means that one delights in solitude after abandoning all social interactions, and cultivates the perfection of wisdom that is the summary of the wholesome factors. This is called delights in solitude.üîΩThe expression is content with little gain and honor means that one is content with little gain and honor, and does not pursue much gain and honor.

original: nyung du tsam shes pa'i shes pa nyid ni shes pa ste /
analyzed: nyung du tsam shes pa'i shes pa nyid ni shes pa ste /
translated: The cognition itself that knows a little is cognition.

original: de'i ngo bo ni shes pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ni shes pa yin gyi /
translated: Its nature is cognition.

original: shes pa zhes bya ba'i sgra rang gi skye bo la ni mi bya ste /
analyzed: shes pa zhes bya ba'i sgra rang gi skye bo la ni mi bya ste /
translated: The word cognition is not applied to its own people.

original: gang gi phyir cung zhig tsam gyis chog shes pa'o zhes phyis 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir cung zhig tsam gyis chog shes pa'o zhes phyis 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it is satisfied with a little, as will be explained later.

original: sems la rnyog pa med pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems la rnyog pa med pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The mind is free from turbidity.

original: nyon mongs pa dang mi 'grogs pa dang / rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa la dmigs pas 'dzin pa med par sbyor ba'i sems ni rnyog pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang mi 'grogs pa dang / rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa la dmigs pas 'dzin pa med par sbyor ba'i sems ni rnyog pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The mind that is not associated with afflictions and that is applied without grasping due to observing natural purity is called free from turbidity.

original: lta bas byas pa rnam par spong ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lta bas byas pa rnam par spong ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: The mind abandons what is done by views.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba sngon du 'gro ba'i lta ba drug cu rtsa gnyis ni rtsa bar gyur pa'i bdag tu lta ba rnam par spangs pas spangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba sngon du 'gro ba'i lta ba drug cu rtsa gnyis ni rtsa bar gyur pa'i bdag tu lta ba rnam par spangs pas spangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The sixty-two views preceded by the view of the transitory collection are abandoned by abandoning the root, the view of self.

original: gzungs thob pa zhes bya ba ni ji skad gsungs pa'i gzungs rnam pa bzhi thob pas phyin ci ma log par don ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu ston pa ni gzungs thob pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzungs thob pa zhes bya ba ni ji skad gsungs pa'i gzungs rnam pa bzhi thob pas phyin ci ma log par don ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu ston pa ni gzungs thob pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The expression attains retention means that, by attaining the four kinds of retention as they have been described, one teaches the unerring reality just as it is. This is called attains retention.

original: ye shes la 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su shes pa la sogs pa'i shes pa rnams phan tshun rjes su zhugs pa nyid du khong du chud pa ni ye shes la 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ye shes la 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su shes pa la sogs pa'i shes pa rnams phan tshun rjes su zhugs pa nyid du khong du chud pa ni ye shes la 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The expression penetrates knowledge means that one understands the mutual penetration of the knowledges of subsequent cognition, etc. This is called penetrates knowledge.

original: gnas @21b zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i chos rnams kyi gnas skabs kyi rten du gyur pa dang / rtsa bar gyur pa ni gnas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gnas @21b zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i chos rnams kyi gnas skabs kyi rten du gyur pa dang / rtsa bar gyur pa ni gnas zhes bya'o //
translated: The expression abides in the stage means that one abides in the stage of the bodhisattva, and that the bodhisattva stage is the basis and foundation of all good qualities. This is called abides in the stage.

original: gnas skabs zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad ni sems kyis bris pa'o zhes bya bas sems nyid kyi gnas skabs las gzhan pa'i gnas ni med pas so //
analyzed: gnas skabs zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad ni sems kyis bris pa'o zhes bya bas sems nyid kyi gnas skabs las gzhan pa'i gnas ni med pas so //
translated: The expression abides in the state means that all dharmas are written by the mind, and that there is no other state than the state of mind. This is called abides in the state.

original: rab tu gnas pa zhes bya ba ni dad pa la sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: rab tu gnas pa zhes bya ba ni dad pa la sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams gnas pa yin te /

original: dad pa med pa'i mi rnams la //
analyzed: dad pa med pa'i mi rnams la //
translated: For people who lack faith

original: dkar po'i chos rnams mi skye ste //
analyzed: dkar po'i chos rnams mi skye ste //
translated: the virtuous qualities do not arise.

original: zhes bya ba ni tshig gis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tshig gis so //
translated: This is stated by the words.

original: sgrub pa shes pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sgrub pa shes pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The knowledge of practice.

original: bsgrub par bya bas na sgrub pa ste /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya bas na sgrub pa ste /
translated: Practice is that which is practiced,

original: lam goms par byas pas bsgrub bya rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: lam goms par byas pas bsgrub bya rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: because the practice of the path brings the accomplishment of the goal to completion.

original: rgyu zhes bya ba la ;
analyzed: rgyu zhes bya ba la ;
translated: The cause.

original: ma rig pa ni rgyu ste 'du byed rnams dang / mi dge ba'i chos rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa ni rgyu ste 'du byed rnams dang / mi dge ba'i chos rnams kyi'o //
translated: Ignorance is the cause of the formative forces and of unwholesome dharmas.

original: rigs pa zhes bya ba ni thar pa dang thar par 'dren par byed pa'i dge ba rnams so //
analyzed: rigs pa zhes bya ba ni thar pa dang thar par 'dren par byed pa'i dge ba rnams so //
translated: The reason is that which leads to liberation and the virtues that lead to liberation.

original: tshul zhes bya ba ni tshul dang lam gang ma rig pa dang sred pa dag dang 'brel ba'i lugs dang ldan zhing don shes pas thar pa thob par byed pa de ni tshul zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshul zhes bya ba ni tshul dang lam gang ma rig pa dang sred pa dag dang 'brel ba'i lugs dang ldan zhing don shes pas thar pa thob par byed pa de ni tshul zhes bya'o //
translated: The method is that method and path which is endowed with the system that is connected with ignorance and craving and which brings about the attainment of liberation through the knowledge of the meaning.

original: sgo zhes bya ba ni thar pa'i grong khyer du 'jug pa'i sgo na thabs la mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: sgo zhes bya ba ni thar pa'i grong khyer du 'jug pa'i sgo na thabs la mkhas pa ste /
translated: The door is the door to the city of liberation, which is skill in means.

original: skyon thams cad spangs nas lam gyi sgo ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyon thams cad spangs nas lam gyi sgo ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because, having abandoned all faults, it shows the door of the path.

original: lam zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lam zhes bya ba la /
translated: The path is that

original: gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang ; bdag med pa dang / stong pa nyid shes pa dang / chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong par rtogs pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi grong khyer du 'jug pa'i lam yin no //
analyzed: gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang ; bdag med pa dang / stong pa nyid shes pa dang / chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong par rtogs pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi grong khyer du 'jug pa'i lam yin no //
translated: which is the path to enter into the no-self of persons and things, namely, the knowledge of impermanence, suffering, no-self, and emptiness, and the realization that all things are empty by nature.

original: sa zhes bya ba ni rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa bcu 'bad pa med par thob pa'i gnas skabs la gnas pa'i rten du gyur pa'i phyir sa zhes bya ba ni sgras brjod do //
analyzed: sa zhes bya ba ni rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa bcu 'bad pa med par thob pa'i gnas skabs la gnas pa'i rten du gyur pa'i phyir sa zhes bya ba ni sgras brjod do //
translated: The stage is so called because it is the basis for the state of attaining the ten stages such as the Joyous without effort.

original: skyed pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba sgrub par byed pa'i las dang bral bas las kyis bskyed pa'i skye ba kun tu bcad pa'o //
analyzed: skyed pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba sgrub par byed pa'i las dang bral bas las kyis bskyed pa'i skye ba kun tu bcad pa'o //
translated: The absence of generation is the cutting off of all births generated by karma, because one is free from the karma that establishes cyclic existence.

original: ye shes kyis zhes bya ba ni bdag la sogs par kun tu rmongs pa dang bral bas chos bdag med pa la 'jug pa ni ye shes kyi sa zhes bya'o //

translated: The stage of wisdom is so called because it is the entry into the selflessness of dharmas, due to being free from the delusion of self, etc.

analyzed: mi shes pa spong ba zhes bya ba ni bdag la sogs par rmongs pa'i ma rig pa ni mi shes pa'o //
translated: The elimination of ignorance is so called because it is the elimination of the ignorance of the delusion of self, etc.

original: de dang 'gal ba'i bdag med pa mthong bas 'dis rab tu spong bas na spong ba zhes bya'o //üîΩshes pa la rab tu gnas pa zhes bya ba ni dmigs par bya ba rdzas med pas @22a * //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba'i bdag med pa mthong bas 'dis rab tu spong bas na spong ba zhes bya'o // shes pa la rab tu gnas pa zhes bya ba ni dmigs par bya ba rdzas med pas @22a * //
translated: It is called elimination because it is the elimination of that by the vision of selflessness which is incompatible with it.

original: dmigs pa med pa la rab tu gnas pa ni shes pa de rang bzhin mthar thug pa la gnas te shes pa la gnas pa zhes bya'o //üîΩrnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa la rab tu gnas pa ni shes pa de rang bzhin mthar thug pa la gnas te shes pa la gnas pa zhes bya'o // rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The stage of knowledge is so called because it is the stage of that knowledge which is the ultimate nature of the knowledge of the non-apprehension of the object, due to the non-existence of the substance which is to be apprehended.

original: bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs bsgom pa ni rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs bsgom pa ni rnal 'byor ro //
translated: The stage of the practice of yoga is so called because it is the practice of the yoga of the cultivation of the dharmas which are the branches of enlightenment, such as the bases of supernatural powers, etc.üîΩThe stage of the practice of yoga is so called because it is the practice of the yoga of the cultivation of the dharmas which are the branches of enlightenment, such as the bases of supernatural powers, etc.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gang la gnas nas kun tu spyod cing goms par byed pa de la rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gang la gnas nas kun tu spyod cing goms par byed pa de la rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa zhes brjod do //
translated: The stage of a bodhisattva who is practicing the path of serenity and transcendent insight is called the stage of a bodhisattva who practices yoga.üîΩ

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod yul zhes bya ba ni spyod yul ni byang chub sems dpa'i yul te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod yul zhes bya ba ni spyod yul ni byang chub sems dpa'i yul te /
translated: The stage of the bodhisattva is called the stage of yoga practice because it is the path of serenity and insight, and it is the practice and cultivation of that path.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / sa thams cad dang / sangs rgyas kyi yon tan rnams so //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / sa thams cad dang / sangs rgyas kyi yon tan rnams so //
translated: The domain of the bodhisattva is the domain of the bodhisattva, which is the six perfections, all the stages, and the qualities of the Buddha.

original: skyes bu dam pa la brten pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen ma nyes par byed pa nyid dang / de dag dang mi 'bral ba'i sems so //
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa la brten pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen ma nyes par byed pa nyid dang / de dag dang mi 'bral ba'i sems so //
translated: Relying on holy men is the mind that is not separated from the Buddhas, bodhisattvas, and spiritual friends, who are not to be criticized.

original: skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa spong ba zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can dmigs pa'i lta ba can rnams dang / dam pa ma yin pa'i lam du zhugs pa rnams ni skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa spong ba zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can dmigs pa'i lta ba can rnams dang / dam pa ma yin pa'i lam du zhugs pa rnams ni skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Avoiding unholy men is the avoidance of the non-Buddhists, who are attached to the view of objective reality, and of those who have entered the inferior vehicle.

original: de rnams 'dul ba'i dus la bab pa ma yin par shes nas mi brten pa ni skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa spong ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams 'dul ba'i dus la bab pa ma yin par shes nas mi brten pa ni skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa spong ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Not to rely on them when one knows that the time has not yet come to convert them is called avoiding those who are not holy men.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: As for the Tathagata's teaching,

original: bden pa zhes bya ba ni lhag mas te /
analyzed: bden pa zhes bya ba ni lhag mas te /
translated: the word truth is implied.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis nyams su bstar nas thar pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i ming gis bstan pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis nyams su bstar nas thar pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i ming gis bstan pa'o //
translated: It is the teaching under the name of liberation and nirvana which is experienced by the knowledge of the Omniscient One.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par thob pa'i sa kun du 'od ni sangs rgyas nyid kyis yin pas sangs rgyas kyi sa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par thob pa'i sa kun du 'od ni sangs rgyas nyid kyis yin pas sangs rgyas kyi sa zhes bya'o //
translated: The stage of the Buddha is the stage of universal light which is attained by the perfection of all good qualities, and is called the stage of the Buddha because it is the Buddha himself.

original: mkhas pa rnams kyis rjes su yi rang ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams kyis rjes su yi rang ba zhes bya ba la /

original: chos nyid ces bya ba ni lhag mas te /
analyzed: chos nyid ces bya ba ni lhag mas te /
translated: the word reality is implied.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byur ba'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis legs so legs so zhes rjes su yi rang ba'o //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byur ba'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis legs so legs so zhes rjes su yi rang ba'o //
translated: The Buddhas, Bodhisattvas, Sravakas, and Pratyekabuddhas of the past, present, and future all rejoice in this, saying, ‚ÄúExcellent, excellent!‚Äù

original: byis pa rnams kyis spangs pa zhes bya ba ni shin tu rtogs par dka' ba'i goms par ma byas pa'i chos nyid kyi de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: byis pa rnams kyis spangs pa zhes bya ba ni shin tu rtogs par dka' ba'i goms par ma byas pa'i chos nyid kyi de kho na nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúAbandoned by the childish‚Äù refers to the reality of the ultimate nature of things, which is extremely difficult to understand and has not been cultivated.

original: thams cad rang bzhin med pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: thams cad rang bzhin med pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúNirvana, which is characterized by the absence of intrinsic existence of all things,‚Äù

original: 'di ni mya ngan las 'das pa ma yin no zhes spong bar byed @22b pa'o ;
analyzed: 'di ni mya ngan las 'das pa ma yin no zhes spong bar byed @22b pa'o ;
translated: is rejected by saying, ‚ÄúThis is not nirvana.‚Äù

analyzed: / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis shes par dka' ba zhes bya ba la zab cing rgya che ba'i sangs rgyas kyi chos bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid la goms par ma byas pa'i sems kyi rgyud yin pa'i phyir de kho na nyid kyi chos nyid
translated: It is difficult to understand for the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: shes par dka' ba'o //
analyzed: shes par dka' ba'o //
translated: The reality of things is difficult to understand because it is the domain of the inconceivable, profound, and vast qualities of the Buddha, which are not the object of the mind that has not become familiar with them.üîΩIt is not for all the tƒ´rthikas.

original: mu stegs can thams cad kyis ma yin pa ni bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen pa'i brdzun pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis thar pa 'dod pa rnams bdag nyid rtag pa la sogs pa'i ngo bor sgom par byed pa de dag gis ma yin pa chos nyidüîΩkyi don de kho na nyid ni de dag gi yul ma yin pa'o //
