translated: The reality of things is not the domain of those who, through the false pride of clinging to ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine,‚Äù desire liberation by cultivating the self as having the nature of permanence, etc.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis yongs su gzung ba zhes bya ba ni rnyed par dka' ba'i lam chen po la nor bu rin po che'i 'du shes dang / nad thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed pa'i sman gyi rgyal po chen po'i 'du shes kyis mi gtong ba'i sems kyis chos nyid yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis yongs su gzung ba zhes bya ba ni rnyed par dka' ba'i lam chen po la nor bu rin po che'i 'du shes dang / nad thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed pa'i sman gyi rgyal po chen po'i 'du shes kyis mi gtong ba'i sems kyis chos nyid yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The phrase it is taken hold of by the bodhisattvas means that it is taken hold of by the Dharma Body of the bodhisattvas, who have the notion of a great jewel toward the great path that is difficult to obtain, and who have the notion of a great king of medicines that cures all illnesses, with a mind that does not abandon.

original: stobs bcu dag gis yongs su gzung ba zhes bya ba la ;
analyzed: stobs bcu dag gis yongs su gzung ba zhes bya ba la ;
translated: The phrase it is taken hold of by the ten powers means that it is taken hold of by the ten powers of the Buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma lus pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i sbyor bas stobs bcu'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs pas rjes su ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma lus pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i sbyor bas stobs bcu'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs pas rjes su ste /
translated: The ten powers are the powers of knowledge that arise from the perfection of the accumulations of merit and knowledge that are perfected by the application to the completion of all the Buddha dharmas.

original: phyi nas sangs rgyas kyis mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: phyi nas sangs rgyas kyis mkhyen pa'o //
translated: The phrase it is known by the Buddhas means that it is known by the Buddhas who have attained the ten powers.

original: lha rnams kyis mchod par bya ba zhes bya ba la /üîΩdpag tu med cing rgyun mi 'chad pa'i bde ba phun sum tshogs pa ni 'di la mchod pa byas pa nyid las 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes shes nas /
analyzed: lha rnams kyis mchod par bya ba zhes bya ba la /üîΩdpag tu med cing rgyun mi 'chad pa'i bde ba phun sum tshogs pa ni 'di la mchod pa byas pa nyid las 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes shes nas /
translated: The phrase it is worshipped by the gods means that the gods worship it.üîΩThe phrase it is worshipped by the gods means that the gods worship it.üîΩThe phrase it is worshipped by the gods means that the gods worship it.

original: de 'dod pa rnams kyis mchod par bya ba yin no //üîΩtshangs pas phyag bya ba zhes bya ba ni thar pa ma yin pa la thar pa'i 'du shes can de dag yang dag pa'i thar pa 'byung ba ni 'di nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: de 'dod pa rnams kyis mchod par bya ba yin no // tshangs pas phyag bya ba zhes bya ba ni thar pa ma yin pa la thar pa'i 'du shes can de dag yang dag pa'i thar pa 'byung ba ni 'di nyid yin gyi /
translated: It is to be worshipped by those who desire it.

original: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes thar pa 'dod pa rnams kyis phyag bya ba yin no //üîΩklu rnams kyis phyag bya ba dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes thar pa 'dod pa rnams kyis phyag bya ba yin no // klu rnams kyis phyag bya ba dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is to be worshipped by Brahma, because those who have the notion of liberation in what is not liberation should worship it with the desire for liberation, thinking that this is the source of true liberation, and not that.

original: dud 'gro'i skye gnas sgrub par byed pa'i lam gyi bag chags kyi rgyun kun tu bcad pa'i phyir phyag 'tshal ba'o //üîΩgnod sbyin gyis rjes su yi rang ba zhes bya ba ni dpe med pa'i longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa thob na yang /
analyzed: dud 'gro'i skye gnas sgrub par byed pa'i lam gyi bag chags kyi rgyun kun tu bcad pa'i phyir phyag 'tshal ba'o // gnod sbyin gyis rjes su yi rang ba zhes bya ba ni dpe med pa'i longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa thob na yang /
translated: It is to be worshipped by the Nagas, because they worship it in order to cut off the continuity of the latent tendencies of the path that leads to rebirth as an animal.

original: ngan 'gro'i lam thams cad yongs su bcad pa'i phyir rab tu dga' ba'i sems kyis rjes su yi rang ba'o //
analyzed: ngan 'gro'i lam thams cad yongs su bcad pa'i phyir rab tu dga' ba'i sems kyis rjes su yi rang ba'o //
translated: It is to be rejoiced in by the Yakshas, because they rejoice with a joyful mind, thinking that they have attained incomparable perfection of enjoyment, and that they have cut off all paths leading to bad rebirths.

original: mi 'am ci rnams kyis bstod par bya ba ni thar par 'dod pa'i rab tu dga' ba dang / rab tu mgu bas chos brjod pa'i dbyangs @23a * //
analyzed: mi 'am ci rnams kyis bstod par bya ba ni thar par 'dod pa'i rab tu dga' ba dang / rab tu mgu bas chos brjod pa'i dbyangs @23a * //
translated: The Kinnaras praise it as the delightful and joyful expression of the Dharma by the melodious sound of those who desire liberation.

original: snyan pas mi 'am ci'i rgyal po ljon pa bzhin du stod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: snyan pas mi 'am ci'i rgyal po ljon pa bzhin du stod par byed pa'o //
translated: They praise it as the melodious sound of the Kinnara king Druma.

original: lto 'phye chen po rnams kyis bsngags par bya ba zhes pa ni drag po chen po'i sems kyis rgyun 'jug pa nye bar bcad pa'i ched du'o //
analyzed: lto 'phye chen po rnams kyis bsngags par bya ba zhes pa ni drag po chen po'i sems kyis rgyun 'jug pa nye bar bcad pa'i ched du'o //
translated: The Mahoragas praise it as the cutting off of the continuity of the great violent mind in order to eliminate the stream of defilements.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bsgom par bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mngon sum du byed pa ni bsgom pa'i la ma thob pas yin gyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bsgom par bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mngon sum du byed pa ni bsgom pa'i la ma thob pas yin gyi /
translated: The Bodhisattvas meditate on it as the direct realization of omniscience, not by the attainment of meditation,

original: tshig tsam gyis ting nge 'dzin rtogs pa ma yin no zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: tshig tsam gyis ting nge 'dzin rtogs pa ma yin no zhes bya bas so //
translated: but by the realization of samadhi through mere words.

original: mkhas pa rnams kyis kun chub par bya ba zhes bya ba ni rig par bya ba rig pa ni mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams kyis kun chub par bya ba zhes bya ba ni rig par bya ba rig pa ni mkhas pa'o //
translated: The wise understand it as the understanding of what is to be understood, and the wise are those who understand.

original: des phyir mi ldog pa'i sa sangs rgyas nyid mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir nye bar bzung nas kun chub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: des phyir mi ldog pa'i sa sangs rgyas nyid mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir nye bar bzung nas kun chub par byed pa'o //
translated: It is the perfection of wisdom, because it is the cause of the realization of the stage of nonregression, which is Buddhahood.

original: bla na med pa'i nor zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba dang 'brel te /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i nor zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba dang 'brel te /
translated: The unsurpassed wealth is connected with the phrase, ‚Äúthe meditative absorption.‚Äù

original: lha dang mir bcas pa'i skye dgu rnams kyi bde ba thams cad kyi rgyur gyur pa dang / thar pa'i bde ba'i rgyur gyur pa ni bla na med pa'i nor zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lha dang mir bcas pa'i skye dgu rnams kyi bde ba thams cad kyi rgyur gyur pa dang / thar pa'i bde ba'i rgyur gyur pa ni bla na med pa'i nor zhes bya'o //
translated: The cause of all the happiness of gods and humans, and the cause of the happiness of liberation, is called the unsurpassed wealth.

original: zang zing med pa'i sbyin pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zang zing med pa'i sbyin pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The generosity that is disinterested is explained as follows.

original: sbyin pa thams cad kyi nang na zang zing med pa'i sems kyis chos spyin pa ni mi shes pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad gcod par byed pa'i phyir chos kyi sbyin pa nyid ni sbyin pa'i mchog go //
analyzed: sbyin pa thams cad kyi nang na zang zing med pa'i sems kyis chos spyin pa ni mi shes pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad gcod par byed pa'i phyir chos kyi sbyin pa nyid ni sbyin pa'i mchog go //
translated: Among all forms of generosity, the gift of Dharma with a disinterested mind is the best form of generosity, because it cuts through all the reactive emotions that are due to ignorance.

original: nad pa rnams kyi sman du gyur pa zhes bya ba la 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug ni 'dan nv na ta ri la sogs pas kyang de dag gi rgyu ma shes shing gso ba yang mi shes pas rtag tu na bde dag gi 'dod chags
analyzed: nad pa rnams kyi sman du gyur pa zhes bya ba la 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug ni 'dan nv na ta ri la sogs pas kyang de dag gi rgyu ma shes shing gso ba yang mi shes pas rtag tu na bde dag gi 'dod chags
translated: It is the medicine for the sick, because it is the medicine for the sicknesses of passion, hatred, and folly. The sicknesses of passion, etc., are not cured by the herbs of NƒÅgƒÅrjuna, etc., because they do not know the cause of those sicknesses.

original: la sogs pa'i nad rnams rab tu zhi bar bya ba'i gos ba'i sman ni 'di lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin nyid yin no //
analyzed: la sogs pa'i nad rnams rab tu zhi bar bya ba'i gos ba'i sman ni 'di lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin nyid yin no //
translated: This concentration is the medicine for the sicknesses of passion, etc., of those who are always sick.

original: ye shes kyi mdzod ces bya ba ni ye shes thams cad sdud par byed pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po sgom pa la mngon par sbyor pa ni ye shes mi zad pa'i mdzod yin pas so //
analyzed: ye shes kyi mdzod ces bya ba ni ye shes thams cad sdud par byed pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po sgom pa la mngon par sbyor pa ni ye shes mi zad pa'i mdzod yin pas so //
translated: It is the inexhaustible treasure of intuition, because it is the treasure of inexhaustible intuition, since it is applied to the cultivation of the concentration-king which includes all intuitions.

original: spobs pa mi zad pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar gnas pa'i chos nyid kyi de nyid rtogs pa dang / mi zad pa'i spobs pa ni spobs pa mi zad pa'i rgyu yin pas so //

translated: It is the inexhaustible eloquence, because it is the cause of inexhaustible eloquence, since it is the realization of the reality of things as they are.

original: mya ngan dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni 'di dag thams cad don med pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi bdag nyid can no zhes shes nas chos thams cad bdag med pa bsgoms pas mya ngan dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mya ngan dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni 'di dag thams cad don med pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi bdag nyid can no zhes shes nas chos thams cad bdag med pa bsgoms pas mya ngan dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The expression free from sorrow means that, having understood that all of this is meaningless and has the nature of suffering, one becomes free from sorrow by cultivating the selflessness of all dharmas.

original: khams gsum pa yongs su shes pa zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa 'di dag ni rmi lam dang 'dra zhes bya bar shes nas de lta bu'i sgyu ma lta bu'i sems can @23b thar bar bya ba'i phyir yongs su mi gtong ba ni khams gsum yongs suüîΩshes pa zhes bya'o //

translated: The expression understanding the three realms means that, having understood that these three realms are like a dream, one does not abandon sentient beings who are like that, like a magical creation, in order to liberate them. This is called understanding the three realms.

original: pha rol tu 'gro ba dag la gzings lta bu zhes bya ba ni lhag pa'i bsam pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' 'dod pa rnams la mi rtag pa la sogs pa bshad pa dang / chos la bdag med pa la sogs pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu 'gro ba dag la gzings lta bu zhes bya ba ni lhag pa'i bsam pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' 'dod pa rnams la mi rtag pa la sogs pa bshad pa dang / chos la bdag med pa la sogs pa bstan pa'o //
translated: The expression like a boat for those who want to go beyond means that for those who desire to attain complete nirvana with the highest intention, impermanence and so on are explained, and the selflessness of dharmas and so on are taught.

analyzed: chu bo'i nang du zhugs pa dag la gru lta bu zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba'i chu klung du lhung zhing rgya mtsho bzhir nub pa rnams sgrol ba'i phyir theg pa chen po'i gru bo che ni mi phyed pa'i gru yin no // grags pa 'dod pa dag gi grags pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad mnyan pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis 'jig rten gyis khams mtha' yas pa na bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa rnams la mchod pa'i phyir dang /
translated: The ‚Äúboat‚Äù for those who have entered the stream is the great ship of the Great Vehicle, which is an undivided boat, in order to rescue those who have fallen into the stream of cyclic existence and are drowning in the four great oceans.

original: sems can rnams kyi don du rab tu spros pas thams cad du khyab pa ni grags pa yin no //

original: gzhan du ma yin no //

translated: The phrase the refutation of opponents in accordance with the Dharma means that one refutes by saying, The subject that is accepted by the tƒ´rthikas has such faults in regard to the dharmas of impermanence, etc.

translated: The phrase ‚Äúnot by all the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas‚Äù means that the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas, who are devoted to the Lesser Vehicle, are frightened and terrified when they hear about the profound and sublime Dharma of the buddhas.

original: rig pa skye ba zhes bya ba ni ji skad bstan pa'i zab cing rgya che ba'i dam pa'i chos thos pa dang / nang du tshul bzhin yid la byed pa ni rig pa skye ba'i rgyu zhes bya'o //

translated: The phrase the source of knowledge means that the bodhisattva hears the profound and extensive teachings of the Dharma as they have been taught, and he or she properly attends to them in thought and word. This is called the source of knowledge.

original: ma rig pa spong ba zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa'i sbyor bas tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa spong ba dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pa nyid bsgom @25b pa ni ma rig pa spang ba zhes bya'o //

translated: The abandonment of ignorance is the abandonment of the incorrect mental orientation through the application of non-apprehension, and the cultivation of the correct mental orientation is the abandonment of ignorance.

original: rnam par grol ba snying por byed pa rnams kyi tshim pa zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i chos 'thob pa'i bdag nyid che ba dang ma bral ba'i dga' ba rjes su 'dzin cing mi gtong ba'o //

translated: The satisfaction of those who make liberation their essence is the maintenance and non-abandonment of the joy that is not divorced from the greatness of the self which is the attainment of the noble dharmas.

original: ting nge 'dzin snying por byed pa rnams kyi dga' ba zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin bde ba sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas nas sems rtse gcig pa dang mi 'bral ba nyid kyi dga' ba'o //

translated: The joy of those who make meditative concentration their essence is the joy of never being divorced from the one-pointed mind which is the meditative concentration that is the bliss common to all beings.

original: blta 'dod pa rnams kyi mig tu gyur pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis brjod du med pa'i chos nyid mngon du byed pa nyid phyin ci ma log par mthong ba'i mig gis blta bar 'dod pa yin gyi /

original: 'gyur ba nyid yin no //

translated: The supernatural power of those who wish to accomplish is the supernatural power of the knowledge of the accomplishment of the knowledge of concentration free from obscurations, which is able to captivate the minds of all sentient beings.

original: thob par 'dod pa rnams kyi gzungs zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa'i gzungs bzhi po de dag thams cad kyis mya ngan las 'das pa dang mnyam pa 'dzin pas na gzungs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thob par 'dod pa rnams kyi gzungs zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa'i gzungs bzhi po de dag thams cad kyis mya ngan las 'das pa dang mnyam pa 'dzin pas na gzungs zhes bya'o //
translated: The dhƒÅra·πáƒ´ of those who wish to attain is the dhƒÅra·πáƒ´ of all those four previously mentioned dhƒÅra·πáƒ´s, called dhƒÅra·πáƒ´ because they hold the equality of nirvƒÅ·πáa.

analyzed: dran pa mi brjed pa zhes bya ba ni 'khor bar gtogs pa'i sbyor ba nyid kyis mya ngan las 'das pa la dmigs pas rang bzhin gyis zhi ba nyid kyis dran pa mi brjed pa'o //
translated: The non-forgetfulness of mindfulness is the non-forgetfulness of mindfulness due to the natural peacefulness of the object of observation of nirvƒÅ·πáa by the mere engagement of the sphere of sa·πÉsƒÅra.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs zhes bya ba la /
translated: The blessings of the buddhas is the blessing of the buddhas.

original: chos kyi skus sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi rgyud la khyab pa mi 'phrogs pa'i sbyor bas byin gyis brlabs pa yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi skus sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi rgyud la khyab pa mi 'phrogs pa'i sbyor bas byin gyis brlabs pa yin no //

original: 'dren pa rnams kyi thabs mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni bde ba thams cad kyi zhi bar 'gro ba ni de nas bzung nas nye bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dren pa rnams kyi thabs mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni bde ba thams cad kyi zhi bar 'gro ba ni de nas bzung nas nye bar 'gyur ba yin no //

original: phra ba zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa ni dmigs par lta ba la mngon par zhen pa rnams kyis shes par dga' ba dang / dmigs pa shes par dga' ba dang / dmigs pa @26a * //üîΩnyid kyi phyir ro /

translated: It is subtle because nirvana is not known by those who are attached to the view of the objective self, and it is not known by those who delight in the knowledge of the objective self, because it is the objective self.

original: shes par dka' ba zhes bya ba ni chos kyi sku'i rang gi ngo bo ni rnam par shes pa'i yul las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir shes par dka' ba'o //
analyzed: shes par dka' ba zhes bya ba ni chos kyi sku'i rang gi ngo bo ni rnam par shes pa'i yul las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir shes par dka' ba'o //
translated: It is difficult to know because the essence of the Dharma Body is difficult to know, since it is beyond the domain of consciousness.

original: dka' bas shes pa zhes bya ba ni byis pa rnams kyi sdug bsngal gyis kyang mi shes pa ste /
analyzed: dka' bas shes pa zhes bya ba ni byis pa rnams kyi sdug bsngal gyis kyang mi shes pa ste /

original: yi ge rnams ldog pa zhes bya ba ni ngag gi lam thams cad mi dmigs par yi ge thams cad kyi nges pa'i tshig gis ston pa ni yi ge rnams ldog pa zhes bya'o //

original: sgras shes par dka' ba zhes bya ba ni so so rang gis rig par bya ba'i de kho na nyid ni tshig tsam gyis rnyed par bya ba ma yin te //

original: rtogs pa rnams kyis kun shes pa zhes bya ba ni lhun gyis grub par rin po che chen po'i 'du shes nyid dang / 'gro ba ma lus pa'i don sgrub pas shes pa ni mkhas pa'o //

original: sdug bsngal zad pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang / gti mug rab tu spangs pas de'i ngo bo med pa'i sdug bsngal zad pa ni sdug bsngal med pa'o //

translated: The qualities of the present life are taught by the Blessed One‚Äôs teaching of the samƒÅdhi, beginning with ‚ÄúYoung man, those who have that kind of practice . . .‚Äù

analyzed: gal te sa brgyad pa la mi skye ba'i chos zab mo la bzod pa thob par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /

analyzed: mig yor lta bu ni phyi dang nang gi don gyis stong pa skra shad la sogs pa snang ba dang 'dra ba nyid do //

translated: When the youthful bodhisattva knows all phenomena in this way, just as they are, then he is said to be skilled in the forbearance of the profound Dharma.

translated: Having gone to the dry land means

analyzed: chu bo bzhi'i 'jigs pa las rnam par grol ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i skam sar phyin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: having gone to the dry land of nirvana, which is the freedom from the fear of the four rivers.

analyzed: bde bar son pa zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal thams cad dang bral ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Having gone to happiness means having attained the path of nirvana, which is free from all suffering.

analyzed: mi 'jigs pa thob pa ni yang 'khor bar ltung ba'i 'jigs pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: Having attained fearlessness means being free from the fear of falling back into samsara.

original: tshul khrims can zhes bya ba ni ngan 'gro thams cad las bzlog pa'i bsil ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi tshul khrims kyis brgyan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims can zhes bya ba ni ngan 'gro thams cad las bzlog pa'i bsil ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi tshul khrims kyis brgyan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Having attained morality means being adorned with the morality of the cool samadhi that turns away from all bad rebirths.

original: ye shes can zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye @43b shes khong du chud pas ye shes la sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: ye shes can zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye @43b shes khong du chud pas ye shes la sbyor ba'o //
translated: Having attained wisdom means being connected with wisdom through having realized the wisdom of omniscience.

original: shes rab can zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa'i chos nyid rab tu rtogs pa'i ngo bo nges par 'byed pa'i shes rab 'di la yod pas zhes byas nas so //
analyzed: shes rab can zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa'i chos nyid rab tu rtogs pa'i ngo bo nges par 'byed pa'i shes rab 'di la yod pas zhes byas nas so //
translated: The one who is called wise is so called because he has the wisdom that is the essence of the realization of the unmistaken reality.

original: bsod nams can zhes bya ba ni bsod nams kyi tshogs dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: bsod nams can zhes bya ba ni bsod nams kyi tshogs dang ldan pas so //
translated: The one who is called meritorious is so called because he has the accumulation of merit.

original: rdzu 'phrul can zhes bya ba ni mngon par shes pa lngas rtse zhing rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul yang dag par ston pa'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul can zhes bya ba ni mngon par shes pa lngas rtse zhing rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul yang dag par ston pa'o //
translated: The one who is called miraculous is so called because he plays with the five superknowledges and displays the miracle of psychic power.

original: dran ba can zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: dran ba can zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The one who is called mindful is so called because he is endowed with the recollection of past lives.

original: blo gros can zhes bya ba ni rigs pa dang grol ba'i spobs pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: blo gros can zhes bya ba ni rigs pa dang grol ba'i spobs pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The one who is called intelligent is so called because he has the eloquence of reasoning and liberation.

original: rtogs pa can zhes bya ba ni bsam pa ci lta ba'i dbang gis bsgrub pa dang rjes su mthun par rtogs pa khong du chud par byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: rtogs pa can zhes bya ba ni bsam pa ci lta ba'i dbang gis bsgrub pa dang rjes su mthun par rtogs pa khong du chud par byed pa nyid do //
translated: The one who is called comprehending is so called because he causes the understanding of what is to be accomplished in accordance with the power of intention.

original: ngo tsha shes pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyi dbang du byas nas sdig pa'i las mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: ngo tsha shes pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyi dbang du byas nas sdig pa'i las mi byed pa'o //
translated: He who is endowed with a sense of shame does not commit sinful actions, considering himself and others.

original: bram ze zhes bya ba ni sdig pa'i chos spangs pas gang gi sdig pa ma lus pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs su gyur pa bzod pa'i ngo bo nges par rtogs pa la bram ze zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bram ze zhes bya ba ni sdig pa'i chos spangs pas gang gi sdig pa ma lus pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs su gyur pa bzod pa'i ngo bo nges par rtogs pa la bram ze zhes bya'o //
translated: He is a Brahmin because he has realized the nature of patience, which is the antidote to all sins, since he has abandoned sinful natures.

original: khrus byas pa ni nyon mongs pa ma lus pa'i dri ma 'khrud par byed pa'i bzod pa'i chu'i nang du rtag tu zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khrus byas pa ni nyon mongs pa ma lus pa'i dri ma 'khrud par byed pa'i bzod pa'i chu'i nang du rtag tu zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is one who has bathed because he has always bathed in the water of patience, which washes away the stains of all the afflictions.

original: pha rol du song bzhes bya ba ni rig byed kyi mthar thug pa'i pha rol tu song bas so //
analyzed: pha rol du song bzhes bya ba ni rig byed kyi mthar thug pa'i pha rol tu song bas so //
translated: He has gone beyond because he has gone beyond the end of the Vedas.

original: rig par byed ces bya ba ni ji skad gsungs pa'i rang bzhin rig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rig par byed ces bya ba ni ji skad gsungs pa'i rang bzhin rig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is a knower because he knows the nature as it is taught.

original: gtsang sbra can ni bya ba ma yin pa thams cad spangs pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: gtsang sbra can ni bya ba ma yin pa thams cad spangs pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: He is pure because he is endowed with the abandonment of all that should not be done.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sras zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rigs skyong bar bzod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sras zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rigs skyong bar bzod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The expression son of the Buddha means that he is the heir of all the Tathagatas, because he is the guardian of the lineage of the Tathagatas.

original: sh'akya'i sras zhes bya ba ni sh'akya'i rigs su 'khrungs pa sh'akya thub pa las nye bar gdags par 'os pa'o //
analyzed: sh'akya'i sras zhes bya ba ni sh'akya'i rigs su 'khrungs pa sh'akya thub pa las nye bar gdags par 'os pa'o //
translated: The expression son of the Sakyas means that he is the son of the Sakya clan, and is worthy of being designated as the Sakyamuni.

original: tsher ma dkrugs pa zhes bya ba ni bdud la sogs pa dang nyon mongs pa'i tsher ma snang ba med par byas pa'o //
analyzed: tsher ma dkrugs pa zhes bya ba ni bdud la sogs pa dang nyon mongs pa'i tsher ma snang ba med par byas pa'o //
translated: The expression one who has uprooted the thorns means that he has eliminated the thorns of the defilements, such as Mara.

original: 'obs dral ba zhes bya ba ni khor ba la sogs pa'i mtshams bcad pa thag ring du bsal ba byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'obs dral ba zhes bya ba ni khor ba la sogs pa'i mtshams bcad pa thag ring du bsal ba byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The expression one who has filled in the ditches means that he has removed the ditches, such as the entanglements, to a great distance.

original: 'obs las brgal bzhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i sa mtshams las rgal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'obs las brgal bzhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i sa mtshams las rgal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The expression one who has crossed over the moat means that he has crossed over the moat of the defilements.

original: zug rngu phyung ba zhes bya ba la phyung ba ni kun nas so //
analyzed: zug rngu phyung ba zhes bya ba la phyung ba ni kun nas so //
translated: The expression one who has extracted the dart means that he has extracted the dart.

original: nyon mongs pa'i bag chags ni zug rngu'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i bag chags ni zug rngu'o //
translated: The latent tendencies of the defilements are the dart.

original: phyung ba ni phyung nas bskyur ba'o //
analyzed: phyung ba ni phyung nas bskyur ba'o //
translated: The expression extracted means that he has extracted and cast it aside.

original: nad med pa ni nyon mongs pa'i gdug pa'i rims nad thams cad dang bral ba'o //

original: ji ltar mi dag nags ri'i khrod 'dug nas //
analyzed: ji ltar mi dag nags ri'i khrod 'dug nas //
translated: Just as people, dwelling in the midst of a forest,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and so on.

original: ji ltar ri'i gcong rong du zhugs pa'i skyes bu ba gad pa dang / dus pa dang / glu blangs pa la sogs pa'i sgra bsgrags pa na de bzhin du pha rol gyi ri las kyang brag ca'i sgra 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang brag ca'i sgras sgra byas pa bzhin du chos thams cad kyang brag ca dang 'dra bar rig par byas la de dag la
analyzed: ji ltar ri'i gcong rong du zhugs pa'i skyes bu ba gad pa dang / dus pa dang / glu blangs pa la sogs pa'i sgra bsgrags pa na de bzhin du pha rol gyi ri las kyang brag ca'i sgra 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang brag ca'i sgras sgra byas pa bzhin du chos thams cad kyang brag ca dang 'dra bar rig par byas la de dag la
translated: Just as when a person in a mountain ravine makes sounds such as laughter, weeping, and singing, the sounds of echoes arise from the opposite mountain, and just as the sound of an echo is not a sound that is made, so too all phenomena should be known to be like an echo.

original: mngon par zhen par mi bya'o //
analyzed: mngon par zhen par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not settle down on them.

original: rmi lam gyi nang du 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga nyams su myong la /
analyzed: rmi lam gyi nang du 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga nyams su myong la /
translated: One experiences the five sense pleasures in a dream,

original: sad pa na dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sad pa na dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: but they are not perceived when one awakens.

original: de lta na yang byis pa'i blo can rnams rmi lam du dmigs pa de la mngon par zhen par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang byis pa'i blo can rnams rmi lam du dmigs pa de la mngon par zhen par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even so, those with childish minds settle down on the objects perceived in dreams.

original: byis pa thams cad kyang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: byis pa thams cad kyang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: All childish people are like that.

original: lha'i dbang po dang rgyal srid kyi dbang phyug la sogs pa la yang mngon par zhen par mi bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lha'i dbang po dang rgyal srid kyi dbang phyug la sogs pa la yang mngon par zhen par mi bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that one should not settle down on the king of gods, the lord of the kingdom, and so on,üîΩhe says:

original: sgyu ma byed pa dag gis gzugs sbrul te //
analyzed: sgyu ma byed pa dag gis gzugs sbrul te //
translated: Magicians conjure up forms

original: rta dang glang po shing rta sna tshogs byas //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rta dang glang po shing rta sna tshogs byas // zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: And create various horses, elephants, and chariots.

original: de bzhin du bu dang chung ma la sogs pa brdzun pas sgro btags pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du bu dang chung ma la sogs pa brdzun pas sgro btags pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: In this way, in order to establish that sons, wives, and so on are just false superimpositions,

original: ji ltar bu mo gzhon nu'i rmi lam na //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ji ltar bu mo gzhon nu'i rmi lam na // zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is just like a young girl in a dream

original: chags pa'i bde ba nam yang ma myong ba'i gzhon nu ma de'i rmi lam gyi mthar mtshan thams cad kyis brgyan pa gzugs bzang ba'i bu zhig skyes par mthong la /
analyzed: chags pa'i bde ba nam yang ma myong ba'i gzhon nu ma de'i rmi lam gyi mthar mtshan thams cad kyis brgyan pa gzugs bzang ba'i bu zhig skyes par mthong la /
translated: A young girl who has never experienced the pleasure of passion sees in a dream that a son is born to her, adorned with all the major and minor parts of the body.

original: de yang yon tan gyi tshogs ma lus pas brgyan pa'i lang tsho la bab pa'i skabs su gyur la /
analyzed: de yang yon tan gyi tshogs ma lus pas brgyan pa'i lang tsho la bab pa'i skabs su gyur la /
translated: And he grows up to the age of puberty, adorned with all the ornaments of good qualities.

original: de'i rjes su shi bar mthong bas bu skyes pas ni dga' zhing shi nas ma mthong bas ni mya ngan du gyur kyang skyes pa yang med la shi ba yang med do //
analyzed: de'i rjes su shi bar mthong bas bu skyes pas ni dga' zhing shi nas ma mthong bas ni mya ngan du gyur kyang skyes pa yang med la shi ba yang med do //
translated: And after that she sees him die. Although she is delighted by the birth of the son and suffers from not seeing him after his death, there is no birth and no death.

original: sngon dang phyi ma'i mthar rang bzhin ma rig pa'i 'jig rten rnams kyi dga' ba dang mya ngan yang gzhon nu mas rmi lam du bu skyes pa dang shi ba mthong ba dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sngon dang phyi ma'i mthar rang bzhin ma rig pa'i 'jig rten rnams kyi dga' ba dang mya ngan yang gzhon nu mas rmi lam du bu skyes pa dang shi ba mthong ba dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The joy and sorrow of the world, which is ignorant of reality in the past and future, are like the joy and sorrow of a young woman who sees her son born and dies in a dream.

original: ji ltar mtshan mo'i chu yi zla ba dag / ces bya ba la sogs pa'i don yang rtogs sla'o //
analyzed: ji ltar mtshan mo'i chu yi zla ba dag / ces bya ba la sogs pa'i don yang rtogs sla'o //
translated: The meaning of the verse beginning ‚ÄúJust as in the night, the moon in water‚Äù is easy to understand.

original: ji ltar so ga'i nyi ma phyed dus na //
analyzed: ji ltar so ga'i nyi ma phyed dus na //
translated: Just as in the summer, at midday,üîΩthe sun‚Äôs rays are very hot,üîΩand in the desert, at midday,üîΩthe sun‚Äôs rays are very hot,üîΩand in the desert, at midday,üîΩthe mirage moves,üîΩand the water is not there,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /üîΩso ga'i zla ba phyi ma'i nyi ma phyed @46a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / so ga'i zla ba phyi ma'i nyi ma phyed @46a * //
translated: so it is with the world.

original: kyi dus la bab pa na drag cing tsha bar 'jug pa'i nyi ma'i 'od zer tsha sgo can gyi sa'i cha las bab pa'i smig rgyu g-yo ba la chu'i phung por mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kyi dus la bab pa na drag cing tsha bar 'jug pa'i nyi ma'i 'od zer tsha sgo can gyi sa'i cha las bab pa'i smig rgyu g-yo ba la chu'i phung por mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the latter summer, at midday, the sun‚Äôs rays are very hot. The mirage moves from the hot ground, and the water is not there.

original: skom pas sems la gnod cing gdung bas chu btung bar 'dod pas 'di na chu mthong ngo zhes rab tu rgyug par byed cing de ji lta ji ltar brgyug pa bzhin du smig rgyu de lta de ltar ring du 'gro ba ltar snang ba na de ngal ba
analyzed: skom pas sems la gnod cing gdung bas chu btung bar 'dod pas 'di na chu mthong ngo zhes rab tu rgyug par byed cing de ji lta ji ltar brgyug pa bzhin du smig rgyu de lta de ltar ring du 'gro ba ltar snang ba na de ngal ba
translated: A thirsty person, tormented by thirst and longing for water, runs to where he sees water. But the mirage moves further away the more he runs.

original: dang skom pa dang tsha bas gdungs pa ma yin pa chu'i thigs pa tsam yang mi rnyed de yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir chu de la btung bar lta ga la nus /
analyzed: dang skom pa dang tsha bas gdungs pa ma yin pa chu'i thigs pa tsam yang mi rnyed de yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir chu de la btung bar lta ga la nus /
translated: He does not find even a drop of water, because it does not exist. How could he drink that water?üîΩIn the same way, the world, deluded by ignorance and craving, runs after the mirage of the aggregates.

original: ma rig pa dang sred pas rmongs pa'i 'jig rten rnams kyang de bzhin du rgyug par byed do zhes bya bas ni 'du shes kyi phung po rang bzhin med par bsgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang sred pas rmongs pa'i 'jig rten rnams kyang de bzhin du rgyug par byed do zhes bya bas ni 'du shes kyi phung po rang bzhin med par bsgrub pa yin no //
translated: This shows that the aggregate of perception is essenceless.üîΩNow, in order to show that the aggregate of compositional factors is essenceless and has no core,

original: da ni 'du byed kyi phung po rang bzhin med pa dang snying po med par brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni 'du byed kyi phung po rang bzhin med pa dang snying po med par brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: it is said:

original: ji ltar chu shing rlon pa'i sdong po la //
analyzed: ji ltar chu shing rlon pa'i sdong po la //
translated: Just as, when the trunk of a plantain treeüîΩis broken down into piecesüîΩand each piece is split up again,üîΩthere is not a plantain tree at all,üîΩso, when a person is broken down into his parts

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
translated: and each part is split up again,üîΩthere is not a person at all.

original: chu shing gi sdong po la snying po brtag par 'dod pas shun pa rnams so sor bsal nas nang ngam phyi rol gang nas kyang snying por gyur pa ci yang mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: chu shing gi sdong po la snying po brtag par 'dod pas shun pa rnams so sor bsal nas nang ngam phyi rol gang nas kyang snying por gyur pa ci yang mi mthong ngo //
translated: Just as when someone wants to examine the pith of a plantain tree, they peel away the outer layers, and find nothing that is pith, either inside or outside.

original: de bzhin du 'du byed du rtog pa rnams phra rab tu rnam par phye nas brtags pa na snying po gyur pa'i lhag ma ci yang lus pa med de /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'du byed du rtog pa rnams phra rab tu rnam par phye nas brtags pa na snying po gyur pa'i lhag ma ci yang lus pa med de /
translated: In the same way, when one analyzes compounded things by dividing them into their most subtle parts, there is nothing left that is a remainder that could be a pith.

original: 'dir snying por gyur pa ni chos thams cad kyi stong pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir snying por gyur pa ni chos thams cad kyi stong pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Here, the pith is the emptiness of all phenomena.

original: de'i phyir chos thams cad kyi stong pa nyid bsgoms pas grol bar 'gyur gyi gzugs la sogs pa bsgoms pas ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir chos thams cad kyi stong pa nyid bsgoms pas grol bar 'gyur gyi gzugs la sogs pa bsgoms pas ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to demonstrate that one is liberated by cultivating the emptiness of all phenomena, not by cultivating form and so on, it is said:

original: mig dang rna ba sna yang tshad ma min //
analyzed: mig dang rna ba sna yang tshad ma min //
translated: The eye, ear, and nose are not valid cognitions.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: And so on.

original: mig dang rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang ; lus dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa rang rang gi yul gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams 'dzin pa'i dbang po de dag gis yul la de dag dmigs pa de kho na nyid kyi ngo bor gal te gyur na ni sems can thams cad kyang 'bad pa med par grol bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mig dang rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang ; lus dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa rang rang gi yul gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams 'dzin pa'i dbang po de dag gis yul la de dag dmigs pa de kho na nyid kyi ngo bor gal te gyur na ni sems can thams cad kyang 'bad pa med par grol bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mental consciousnesses, which are the faculties that apprehend their respective objects, forms, sounds, smells, tastes, tangible objects, and phenomena, if they were to be the nature of the reality that is the object of observation, then all sentient beings would be liberated without effort.üîΩIn order to demonstrate this, it says:

original: byis pas de nyid rig gyur na //
analyzed: byis pas de nyid rig gyur na //
translated: If fools knew reality,

original: de nyid shes pas ci zhig bya //üîΩzhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid shes pas ci zhig bya // zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: then what use would wisdom be?

original: dbang po dang dbang po'i don rnams ngo bo nyid kyis bems po'o //
analyzed: dbang po dang dbang po'i don rnams ngo bo nyid kyis bems po'o //
translated: The faculties and their objects are matter by nature.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i 'bras bu ster bar mi nus par lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i 'bras bu ster bar mi nus par lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
translated: They are neutral, unable to give a virtuous or nonvirtuous effect.

original: de'i phyir don dam pa'i rgyu ma yin @46b te ;
analyzed: de'i phyir don dam pa'i rgyu ma yin @46b te ;
translated: Therefore, they are not the ultimate cause.

original: don dam par dge ba ni thar ba'o zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: don dam par dge ba ni thar ba'o zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
translated: The word ‚Äúliberation‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúultimate virtue is liberation‚Äù is used in this way.

original: de'i phyir gang mya ngan las 'das pa don du gnyer ba rnams kyis mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'phags pa'i lam sgom pas rang gi dgos pa gyis shig / gzhan du na phyi rol gyi don la mngon bar zhen pa rnams la
analyzed: de'i phyir gang mya ngan las 'das pa don du gnyer ba rnams kyis mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'phags pa'i lam sgom pas rang gi dgos pa gyis shig / gzhan du na phyi rol gyi don la mngon bar zhen pa rnams la
translated: Otherwise, those who are attached to external objects

original: mya ngan las 'das pa med do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa med do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: will say, ‚ÄúThere is no nirvana.‚Äù

original: don de dag nyid bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩlus la sngon gyi mtha' ma rab brtags na //
analyzed: don de dag nyid bstan pa'i phyir / lus la sngon gyi mtha' ma rab brtags na //
translated: In order to teach those very topics,üîΩit is said, ‚ÄúHaving thoroughly examined the body,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: from the beginning it is not found.‚Äù

original: gzod ma nas zhi ba'i phyir sngon gyi mtha' yang med la /
analyzed: gzod ma nas zhi ba'i phyir sngon gyi mtha' yang med la /
translated: Since it is peaceful from the beginning, there is no prior limit.

original: skye ba yang med pa la nyams pa yang med pas phyi ma'i mtha' yang med do //
analyzed: skye ba yang med pa la nyams pa yang med pas phyi ma'i mtha' yang med do //
translated: Since there is no arising, there is also no decline, so there is no later limit.

original: de dag gnyi ga med pas dbus kyang yod pa ma yin pas de ni 'dus ma byas kyi rigs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gnyi ga med pas dbus kyang yod pa ma yin pas de ni 'dus ma byas kyi rigs zhes bya'o //
translated: Since neither of those two exists, the middle also does not exist. That is called the family of the unconditioned.üîΩIn order to teach that the cultivation of the unconditioned realm of phenomena is the noble person,

original: chos kyi dbyings 'dus ma byas kyi bsgom pa ni 'phags pa'i gang zag go zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings 'dus ma byas kyi bsgom pa ni 'phags pa'i gang zag go zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: it is said,

original: mya ngan 'das pa'i chos la chos med de //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa'i chos la chos med de //
translated: In the dharma of nirvana there is no dharma.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: In this verse,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos rnams nges par grub pa ste chos rnams nyid ye nas med pas mya ngan las 'das pa yod par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos rnams nges par grub pa ste chos rnams nyid ye nas med pas mya ngan las 'das pa yod par ga la 'gyur /
translated: the dharmas of nirvana are definitely established. Since dharmas themselves are primordially nonexistent, how could nirvana exist?

original: yod dang med ces bya bar rtogs pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi sdug bsngal nam yang zhi bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yod dang med ces bya bar rtogs pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi sdug bsngal nam yang zhi bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: For those who possess the realization of existence and nonexistence, suffering will never be pacified.

original: de ltar spyod pa'i sdug bsngal zhi mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de ltar spyod pa'i sdug bsngal zhi mi 'gyur //
translated: The suffering of those who engage in that way will not be pacified.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: In this verse,

original: de ltar spyod par byed na zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: de ltar spyod par byed na zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: the meaning is ‚Äúif one engages in that way.‚Äù

original: rgyu ma tshang ba med pa'i 'bras bu nyams par mi rigs so zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: rgyu ma tshang ba med pa'i 'bras bu nyams par mi rigs so zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis so //
translated: The way of reasoning is that it is illogical for a result to be impaired when its cause is complete.

original: yod ces pa ni mtha' gcig med pa gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /üîΩyod pa sngon 'gro med pa ste //
analyzed: yod ces pa ni mtha' gcig med pa gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / yod pa sngon 'gro med pa ste //
translated: ‚ÄúExistence‚Äù is one extreme. ‚ÄúNonexistence‚Äù and so on.üîΩExistence precedes nonexistence.

original: med pa 'ang yod pa sngon 'gro yin //
analyzed: med pa 'ang yod pa sngon 'gro yin //
translated: Nonexistence precedes existence.

original: de phyir med ces mi brjod cing /
analyzed: de phyir med ces mi brjod cing /
translated: Therefore, do not say ‚Äúnonexistent.‚Äù

original: yod pa nyid du 'ang brtag mi bya //
analyzed: yod pa nyid du 'ang brtag mi bya //
translated: Do not conceive of it as existent.

original: zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the teaching.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Likewise,

original: gtsang dang mi gtsang 'di yang mtha' yin te //
analyzed: gtsang dang mi gtsang 'di yang mtha' yin te //
translated: ‚ÄúPure and impure are extremes.üîΩ‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Here,

original: yod pa dang / med pa dang / gtsang ba dang / mi gtsang ba la sogs par rtsod par thob par gyur pas ni sdug bsngal nyid rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yod pa dang / med pa dang / gtsang ba dang / mi gtsang ba la sogs par rtsod par thob par gyur pas ni sdug bsngal nyid rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: those who have fallen into disputes about existence and nonexistence, pure and impure, and so on, increase suffering.

original: de phyir gnyi ga'i mtha' ni rnam spangs nas //
analyzed: de phyir gnyi ga'i mtha' ni rnam spangs nas //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore, having abandoned both extremes,üîΩ‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and so on.

original: rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i mtha' gnyis rnam par spangs nas dbus la mngon par zhen pa yang spangs te /
analyzed: rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i mtha' gnyis rnam par spangs nas dbus la mngon par zhen pa yang spangs te /
translated: Having abandoned the two extremes that are the basis of dispute, one should also abandon attachment to the middle.

original: chos zab mo la bzod pa ji skad bstan pa bzhin du bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni mdor @47a * //üîΩbsdus pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: chos zab mo la bzod pa ji skad bstan pa bzhin du bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni mdor @47a * // bsdus pa'i don yin no //
translated: One should cultivate the profound Dharma just as it is taught. This is the summarized meaning.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i gtam byas te //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i gtam byas te //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving spoken the discourse on the foundations of mindfulness,üîΩ‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and so on.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i gtam byas pa nyid kyis de kho na nyid lus kyi mngon sum du byed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i gtam byas pa nyid kyis de kho na nyid lus kyi mngon sum du byed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: By merely discussing the applications of mindfulness, one does not make the reality of the body manifest.üîΩSimilarly, by merely discussing the meditative concentrations and the truths, one does not see the meditative concentrations and the truths.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan gyi gtam dang / bden pa'i gtam byas pa tsam gyis bsam gtan dang bden pa mthong bar mi 'gyur ro zhes thams cad du dregs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i skyon rnams bkru bar bya'o zhes slob par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan gyi gtam dang / bden pa'i gtam byas pa tsam gyis bsam gtan dang bden pa mthong bar mi 'gyur ro zhes thams cad du dregs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i skyon rnams bkru bar bya'o zhes slob par mdzad pa'o //
translated: Thus, one should train in order to wash away all the faults of the afflictions of pride.

original: tshul khrims bsrung zhing de yis snyems mi bya //
analyzed: tshul khrims bsrung zhing de yis snyems mi bya //
translated: One should guard morality, but not be conceited about it.

original: chos rnams mnyan cing des ni mi bsnyems te //
analyzed: chos rnams mnyan cing des ni mi bsnyems te //
translated: One should listen to the Dharma, but not be conceited about it.

original: zhes bya ba la /üîΩbdag ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la / bdag ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Here,üîΩone should not be conceited, thinking, ‚ÄúI have morality,‚Äù

original: bdag ni mang du thos pa'o zhes khengs par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: bdag ni mang du thos pa'o zhes khengs par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: up to ‚ÄúI have listened to much Dharma.‚Äù

original: dregs pa sdug bsngal rtsa ba yin par bstan //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dregs pa sdug bsngal rtsa ba yin par bstan // zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is taught that pride is the root of suffering.

original: bsnyems shing nga rgyal byed pa ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ste byed pa yin no //
analyzed: bsnyems shing nga rgyal byed pa ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ste byed pa yin no //
translated: Pride and conceit are the cause and the making of suffering.

original: rgyags par dregs pas sdug bsngal rab tu 'phel //üîΩzhes bya ba la ;
analyzed: rgyags par dregs pas sdug bsngal rab tu 'phel // zhes bya ba la ;
translated: Because of pride in his own excellence, his suffering increases.

original: rgyags pas dregs shing khengs par gyur pa ni sdug bsngal nyid 'phel bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyags pas dregs shing khengs par gyur pa ni sdug bsngal nyid 'phel bar 'gyur te /
translated: He who is proud and conceited because of his own excellence increases his suffering.

original: sdug bsngal dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of his opposition to the suffering of others.

original: bzlog nas rgyags pa dang bral bar gyur na ni sdug bsngal thams cad 'gag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bzlog nas rgyags pa dang bral bar gyur na ni sdug bsngal thams cad 'gag par 'gyur te /
translated: But when he turns away from that and becomes free of pride, then all his suffering ceases.

original: sdug bsngal dang 'gal ba'i bde ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang 'gal ba'i bde ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of his conformity to the happiness of others.

original: ji snyed chos mang yongs su chub byas nas //üîΩzhes bya ba la /üîΩgal te mang du thos pa yin na yang tshul khrims srung bar mi byed cing /
analyzed: ji snyed chos mang yongs su chub byas nas // zhes bya ba la / gal te mang du thos pa yin na yang tshul khrims srung bar mi byed cing /
translated: Having fully understood the many teachings,üîΩIf he is learned but does not observe morality, and if he is proud, thinking, ‚ÄúI am learned,‚Äù then his morality being impaired, he goes to a miserable rebirth.

original: bdag ni mang du thos pa yin no zhes nga rgyal byed na tshul khrims nyams pas de ngan 'gror 'gro ba la thos pa mang pos skyob par mi nus so //
analyzed: bdag ni mang du thos pa yin no zhes nga rgyal byed na tshul khrims nyams pas de ngan 'gror 'gro ba la thos pa mang pos skyob par mi nus so //
translated: His great learning cannot protect him.

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims tsam gyis mgu zhing thos pa mang po tshol bar mi byed na de tshul khrims kyi 'bras bu nyams su myong nas de zad ba dang yang ngan 'gror ltung nas sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims tsam gyis mgu zhing thos pa mang po tshol bar mi byed na de tshul khrims kyi 'bras bu nyams su myong nas de zad ba dang yang ngan 'gror ltung nas sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Likewise, if one is satisfied with mere morality and does not seek much learning, then, having experienced the result of morality, when that is exhausted, one falls again into miserable realms and experiences suffering.

original: de bzhin du dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i sgom pas kyang nyon mongs pa zad bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar /
analyzed: de bzhin du dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i sgom pas kyang nyon mongs pa zad bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar /
translated: Likewise, afflictions are not exhausted by meditation that has an object.

original: 'jig rten pa'i ting nge 'dzin sgom byed kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i ting nge 'dzin sgom byed kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Even if one cultivates mundane concentration,

original: bdag tu mngon par zhen pa sngon du 'gro ba'i 'jig rten pa'i sgom pas kyang /
analyzed: bdag tu mngon par zhen pa sngon du 'gro ba'i 'jig rten pa'i sgom pas kyang /
translated: because of the prior engagement of manifest clinging to a self,üîΩthe afflictions arise again.

original: de nyid nyon mongs phyir yang rab tu ldang // bdag tu 'du shes can la /
analyzed: de nyid nyon mongs phyir yang rab tu ldang // bdag tu 'du shes can la /
translated: For one who has the notion of self,

original: bdag yod na ni gzhan du 'du shes shing //
analyzed: bdag yod na ni gzhan du 'du shes shing //
translated: when there is a self, there is the notion of other.

original: bdag gzhan cha las yongs su 'dzin dang @47b ldang ; / de nyid dang ni kun tu 'brel pa las //
analyzed: bdag gzhan cha las yongs su 'dzin dang @47b ldang ; / de nyid dang ni kun tu 'brel pa las //
translated: From the aspect of self and other arises grasping and aversion.üîΩFrom that,

original: nyon mongs thams cad rab tu skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: nyon mongs thams cad rab tu skye bar 'gyur //
translated: All the afflictions arise.

original: zhes bstan pas so //
analyzed: zhes bstan pas so //
translated: This is the teaching.

original: dpe bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩlhag spyod kyis ni ting 'dzin 'dir bsgoms bzhin //
analyzed: dpe bstan pa'i phyir / lhag spyod kyis ni ting 'dzin 'dir bsgoms bzhin //
translated: In order to illustrate this,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: he says,üîΩAs in the case of Udraka, who cultivated this concentration.

original: lhag spyod ni phyogs kyi gos can no //
analyzed: lhag spyod ni phyogs kyi gos can no //
translated: Udraka was Parivrajakakaushthila.

original: de 'dod chags dang bral bar rdzu 'phrul gyis nam mkha' la 'gro ba mthong nas de lta bu 'dod pa'i bcos ma'i sems kyis bstan pa 'di la zhugs nas ting nge 'dzin bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis rdzu 'phrul mngon du byas par gyur to //
analyzed: de 'dod chags dang bral bar rdzu 'phrul gyis nam mkha' la 'gro ba mthong nas de lta bu 'dod pa'i bcos ma'i sems kyis bstan pa 'di la zhugs nas ting nge 'dzin bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis rdzu 'phrul mngon du byas par gyur to //
translated: Seeing him go through the air free from attachment, with a contrived mind desiring to be like him, he entered this teaching and through the power of cultivating concentration, he manifested supernormal powers.

original: de rdzu 'phrul thob nas phyogs kyi gos can gyi bstan pa la yang 'di lta bu'i rdzu 'phrul yod do zhes yang phyogs kyi 'os can du gyur nas nam mkha' la song ngo //
analyzed: de rdzu 'phrul thob nas phyogs kyi gos can gyi bstan pa la yang 'di lta bu'i rdzu 'phrul yod do zhes yang phyogs kyi 'os can du gyur nas nam mkha' la song ngo //
translated: Having attained supernormal powers, he became known as one with such supernormal powers in the teaching of Parivrajakakaushthila, and went through the air.

original: de la dus gzhan zhig na khyod kyis bsgoms pa 'di ni lam ma yin no zhes brtsad pa dang / rdzu 'phrul las nyams nas sa la lhung ste dmyal bar song bar gyur to //
analyzed: de la dus gzhan zhig na khyod kyis bsgoms pa 'di ni lam ma yin no zhes brtsad pa dang / rdzu 'phrul las nyams nas sa la lhung ste dmyal bar song bar gyur to //
translated: You will fall from your psychic powers, fall to the ground, and go to hell.

original: de lta bas na bdag med pa bsgoms pa las gzhan gyis grol bar 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na bdag med pa bsgoms pa las gzhan gyis grol bar 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, it is taught that liberation is not attained by any means other than meditation on selflessness.

original: gal te bdag med chos la rab rtog cing //
analyzed: gal te bdag med chos la rab rtog cing //
translated: If one thoroughly investigates the teaching of selflessness,

original: zhes bya ba gsungs pa la gal te chos thams cad bdag med par sngar ci skad gsungs pa bzhin rnam grangs kyis nges par brtags nas dmigs pa thams cad spangs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs pa la gal te chos thams cad bdag med par sngar ci skad gsungs pa bzhin rnam grangs kyis nges par brtags nas dmigs pa thams cad spangs te /
translated: If one thoroughly investigates, by means of the above-mentioned categories, the teaching that all phenomena are selfless, and abandons all objectifications,

original: bsgoms pas chos thams cad bdag med par sgom pa kho na mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa'i rgyu yin gyi /
analyzed: bsgoms pas chos thams cad bdag med par sgom pa kho na mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa'i rgyu yin gyi /
translated: then the meditation on the selflessness of all phenomena is the only cause for attaining nirvana.

original: rgyu gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no other cause.

original: tshul khrims kyi rkang pa dang bral bas 'khor ba las 'bros par 'dod na yang 'gro ba ni med do zhes chom rkun gyi dpe bstan pa'i tshe /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi rkang pa dang bral bas 'khor ba las 'bros par 'dod na yang 'gro ba ni med do zhes chom rkun gyi dpe bstan pa'i tshe /
translated: When the example of the thief was taught:

original: mi zhig chom rkun tshogs kyis rab gtses nas //
analyzed: mi zhig chom rkun tshogs kyis rab gtses nas //
translated: A man is greatly afflicted by a band of thieves.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: And so on.

original: chom rkun gyis shin tu gtses pas rang gi srog yongs su skyob par 'dod pa dag 'bros par 'dod pa las 'jigs pas bred cing brgyal ba'i rkang pas 'bros pa'i nus pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chom rkun gyis shin tu gtses pas rang gi srog yongs su skyob par 'dod pa dag 'bros par 'dod pa las 'jigs pas bred cing brgyal ba'i rkang pas 'bros pa'i nus pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who are greatly afflicted by thieves, who wish to save their lives, who wish to flee, are unable to flee with legs paralyzed by fear.

original: de bzhin tshul khrims nyams pa rmongs pa'i mi //
analyzed: de bzhin tshul khrims nyams pa rmongs pa'i mi //
translated: In the same way, a man whose morality is impaired

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dpe bstan pa la sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dpe bstan pa la sbyor bar byed do //
translated: And so on.

original: tshul khrims nyams pa des 'bros par mi nus pa ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims nyams pa des 'bros par mi nus pa ste /
translated: He who is impaired in morality is unable to flee.

original: tshul khrims kyi rkang pa dang bral ba'i phyir 'khor ba'i khams las bdag nyid 'bros par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi rkang pa dang bral ba'i phyir 'khor ba'i khams las bdag nyid 'bros par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Because he is devoid of the foot of morality, he is unable to flee by himself from the realm of cyclic existence.

original: rgas pa dang 'chi ba dang nad la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i dgras ngan @48a * //
analyzed: rgas pa dang 'chi ba dang nad la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i dgras ngan @48a * //
translated: The various afflictions, such as old age, death, and sickness, are the enemies.

original: 'gro gsum du lhung bar byed do //
analyzed: 'gro gsum du lhung bar byed do //
translated: They cause one to fall into the three miserable realms.

original: yang bdag med pa legs par bsgoms par gyur pa khros sam gshes kyang bdag dang gzhan gyi cha'i rtog pa dang bral ba'i phyir khro ba la sogs pa skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang bdag med pa legs par bsgoms par gyur pa khros sam gshes kyang bdag dang gzhan gyi cha'i rtog pa dang bral ba'i phyir khro ba la sogs pa skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, even if one who has well cultivated selflessness becomes angry or hateful, anger, etc. do not arise, because he is free from the discrimination of self and other.üîΩIn order to demonstrate this, it says:

original: stong par shes pa de la 'khrug pa med //üîΩces bya ba'o //
analyzed: stong par shes pa de la 'khrug pa med // ces bya ba'o //
translated: There is no disturbance for one who knows emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid mi shes pa de la khros pa la sogs pa 'byung ngo zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: stong pa nyid mi shes pa de la khros pa la sogs pa 'byung ngo zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that anger, etc. arise for one who does not know emptiness, it says:

original: 'gro mang phung po stong par ston mod gyi //
analyzed: 'gro mang phung po stong par ston mod gyi //
translated: Although many people are taught that the aggregates are empty,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: etc.üîΩEmptiness is not understood by mere verbal reification.

original: tshig gis sgro btags pa tsam gyis stong pa nyid rtogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig gis sgro btags pa tsam gyis stong pa nyid rtogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to demonstrate this, it says:

original: mi shes de dag gzhan gyis brgal na yang //
analyzed: mi shes de dag gzhan gyis brgal na yang //
translated: Even though others dispute with them,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In this and other verses.

original: gzhan gyis brgal ba na khro bas zil gyis non nas drag cing rtsub pa'i tshig gi mtshon chas gzhan la gnod pa byed pa la 'jug par 'gyur gyis /
analyzed: gzhan gyis brgal ba na khro bas zil gyis non nas drag cing rtsub pa'i tshig gi mtshon chas gzhan la gnod pa byed pa la 'jug par 'gyur gyis /
translated: When others dispute, they are overcome by anger and engage in harming others with the weapon of harsh and rude words.

original: ji skad gsungs pa'i stong pa nyid dran par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji skad gsungs pa'i stong pa nyid dran par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They do not recall emptiness as it is taught.

original: de dag nyid de ma thag pa'i dpes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag nyid de ma thag pa'i dpes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just those with an example,

original: mi dag na zhing lus ni sdug bsngal ltar //
analyzed: mi dag na zhing lus ni sdug bsngal ltar //
translated: just as people who are sick and whose bodies are suffering

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and so on.

original: yun ring po'i dus su nad kyis gnod cing nyam thag bar gyur pa'i sdug bsngal gyis zil gyis mnan pa dag nad gso ba'i phyir sman pa la bsten par 'dod nas btsal ban nad kyi rgyu dang gso ba la mkhas pa gzhan la phan pa byed pa la
analyzed: yun ring po'i dus su nad kyis gnod cing nyam thag bar gyur pa'i sdug bsngal gyis zil gyis mnan pa dag nad gso ba'i phyir sman pa la bsten par 'dod nas btsal ban nad kyi rgyu dang gso ba la mkhas pa gzhan la phan pa byed pa la
translated: Those who are overcome by the suffering of being afflicted for a long time by illness and distress, who desire to rely on a doctor in order to be cured of their illness, and who search for a doctor who is skilled in the causes of illness and their cure, who benefits others,

original: brtson pa snying rje chen po dang ldan pa'i sman pa yang dag par rnyed nas des kyang nad thams cad zhi bar byed pa'i nus pa'i sman nad pa de la byin na nad pa de nad bsal ba'i phyir bsten par mi byed na gang gis nyes zhes bya
analyzed: brtson pa snying rje chen po dang ldan pa'i sman pa yang dag par rnyed nas des kyang nad thams cad zhi bar byed pa'i nus pa'i sman nad pa de la byin na nad pa de nad bsal ba'i phyir bsten par mi byed na gang gis nyes zhes bya
translated: If a patient finds a doctor who is diligent and has great compassion and the doctor gives the patient medicine that has the power to cure all diseases, but the patient does not rely on the medicine to cure his disease, who is to blame?

original: bar / sman pas ma lan sman gyis ma nyes te //
analyzed: bar / sman pas ma lan sman gyis ma nyes te //
translated: The doctor is not to blame, nor is the medicine.

original: zhes bya ba la ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba la ;
translated: The patient is to blame.

original: ji ltar rigs pa'i sman bsten na nad sel bar nus kyi ma bsten par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar rigs pa'i sman bsten na nad sel bar nus kyi ma bsten par ni ma yin no //
translated: If he relies on the medicine in the proper way, the medicine can cure his disease, but if he does not rely on it, it cannot.

original: de ni nad pa nyid kyis nyes pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni nad pa nyid kyis nyes pa yin te /
translated: The patient is to blame.

original: sman mi bsten pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi'o zhes bya bas skabs la bab pa dang sbyar ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sman mi bsten pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi'o zhes bya bas skabs la bab pa dang sbyar ba'i phyir /
translated: The patient is to blame because he does not rely on the medicine.

original: de bzhin bstan pa 'di la rab byung ste //
analyzed: de bzhin bstan pa 'di la rab byung ste //
translated: In the same way, those who have gone forth in this teaching

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and so on.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa 'di la rab tu byung nas stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa la sogs pa thob nas sman bsten pa'i gnas lta bu'i sgom pa gang yin pa la sbyor bar mi byed pa ni sgom pa la rjes su sbyor ba dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid can mya ngan las 'das @48b pa'i nad med pa thob par mi
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa 'di la rab tu byung nas stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa la sogs pa thob nas sman bsten pa'i gnas lta bu'i sgom pa gang yin pa la sbyor bar mi byed pa ni sgom pa la rjes su sbyor ba dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid can mya ngan las 'das @48b pa'i nad med pa thob par mi
translated: Having gone forth in this doctrine of the TathƒÅgata, they do not apply themselves to the meditation that is like a medicine, which is the characteristic of being free from application to meditation, and they do not attain the disease-free nirvana.

original: 'gyur ro // de lta bas na dngos po med pa stong ba'o zhes don dam pa sgom pa la sbyor bar byed pa ni sangs rgyas kyi sras su 'gyur gyi mu stegs pas yongs su brtags pa'i phyogs gcig stong pa nyid ni yongs su spong bar byed de /
analyzed: 'gyur ro // de lta bas na dngos po med pa stong ba'o zhes don dam pa sgom pa la sbyor bar byed pa ni sangs rgyas kyi sras su 'gyur gyi mu stegs pas yongs su brtags pa'i phyogs gcig stong pa nyid ni yongs su spong bar byed de /
translated: Therefore, those who apply themselves to the meditation on the ultimate, which is the emptiness of non-existent things, become children of the Buddha, but they abandon the emptiness of one part imagined by the tƒ´rthikas.

original: 'khor ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro zhes bar /
analyzed: 'khor ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro zhes bar /
translated: Because it is in accord with sa·πÉsƒÅra.üîΩAs it is said:

original: srid pa thams cad yong ye stong pa ste //
analyzed: srid pa thams cad yong ye stong pa ste //
translated: All existences are completely empty.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan to //
translated: And so on.

original: de ni sems can thams cad kyi nad thams cad rjes su 'dzin pa'i brtse ba chen po dang ldan na yang byis pa'i skye bo spang bar bya ba'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni sems can thams cad kyi nad thams cad rjes su 'dzin pa'i brtse ba chen po dang ldan na yang byis pa'i skye bo spang bar bya ba'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the cause of abandoning the childish person, he says:

original: mkhas pa byis pa dag dang rtsod mi byed //
analyzed: mkhas pa byis pa dag dang rtsod mi byed //
translated: The wise do not dispute with the childish.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa la mkhas pa ni blo dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa la mkhas pa ni blo dang ldan pa ste /
translated: Here, the wise are the intelligent ones.

original: ji skad gsungs pa'i gsung rab la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: ji skad gsungs pa'i gsung rab la mkhas pa'o //
translated: They are wise in the scriptures as they are taught.

original: byis pa ni mi shes pa ste /
analyzed: byis pa ni mi shes pa ste /
translated: The childish are the ignorant ones.

original: de dang rtsod par mi byed de /
analyzed: de dang rtsod par mi byed de /
translated: They do not dispute with them.

original: bzlog nas ri mor byas nas spong ba ni bdag la brten nas sems gdug pa bskyed pas ngan 'gror 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes bsam pa'o //
analyzed: bzlog nas ri mor byas nas spong ba ni bdag la brten nas sems gdug pa bskyed pas ngan 'gror 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes bsam pa'o //
translated: They avoid them by turning away from them and honoring them, thinking, ‚ÄúIf I rely on them, I will generate a malicious mind and go to a bad rebirth.‚Äù

analyzed: byis pa'i sems kyi rgyud rig pas grogs por yang mi byed do //
translated: They do not even make friends with the childish, knowing the nature of their minds.

original: grogs po'i grogs po nyid kyang des mi shes te dgra dang 'dra bar 'gyur //
analyzed: grogs po'i grogs po nyid kyang des mi shes te dgra dang 'dra bar 'gyur //
translated: They do not even know what a friend is, and they become like enemies.

original: zhes so so'i skye bo'i grogs la mkhas pa rnams yid rton par mi byed do //
analyzed: zhes so so'i skye bo'i grogs la mkhas pa rnams yid rton par mi byed do //
translated: The wise do not trust the friendship of ordinary people.

original: byis pa dang ni byis par mthun sbyor ba //
analyzed: byis pa dang ni byis par mthun sbyor ba //
translated: The childish are in harmony with the childish.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Here,

original: 'dod pa mthun pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dod pa mthun pa'i phyir /
translated: because of having similar desires,

original: ji ltar mi gtsang ba dang mi gtsang bzhin //üîΩzhes gsungs te /
analyzed: ji ltar mi gtsang ba dang mi gtsang bzhin // zhes gsungs te /
translated: they are like filth with filth.

original: mi gtsang ba dang mi gtsang ba chen por 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi gtsang ba dang mi gtsang ba chen por 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they are similar to great filth with filth.

original: mkhas pa dag ni mkhas pa'i skye bo dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /üîΩyongs su dag pa ni yongs su dag pa dang grogs po zhes bya bar ;
analyzed: mkhas pa dag ni mkhas pa'i skye bo dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / yongs su dag pa ni yongs su dag pa dang grogs po zhes bya bar ;
translated: The wise are in harmony with the wise.üîΩHere,üîΩbecause of having similar purity, they are like clarified butter with clarified butter.

original: mthun bzhin 'byor pa mar dang nyid khu bzhin //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mthun bzhin 'byor pa mar dang nyid khu bzhin // zhes gsungs so //
translated: They are like clarified butter with clarified butter.

original: 'khor ba'i skyon ma mthong ba dang / las dang rnam par smin pa ston pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka' la ma dad pa'i phyir slob pa nyams pa la sogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar /
